She has a lot of customers and her daily sales are very high especially during the rainy season since her shop is in her community. A problem she faces is the high cost of transportation. She is requesting a loan to purchase more soft drinks, rice, oil, etc. for her business. She plans to expand her business and build a store in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more soft drinks, rice, oil, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Rosemary

texts.en:
Rosemary is married and has three children, two in school and one who is still too young. She lives in a rental house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and rent.

For over two years, Rosemary has been operating a beauty salon business. Her potential customers are her neighbors and town dwellers. She dreams of incorporating her business to open a beauty training school. 

With the loan that she is requesting she wants to purchase braids, hair oil, hair extensions, hair treatments, and shampoo. She joined Yehu because of favorable loaning requirements.

loans.use: to purchase braids, hair oil, hair extensions, hair treatments, and shampoo

loans.name: Soeurt's Group

texts.en:
Soeurt is 47 years old and married.  She is a villager from Ek Phnom district of Battambang province. Her main source of income is from their fish and snail selling business. Her husband has helped her to earn a living via fish catching. She has been involved in her current business for 10 years. Including this loan, she is a fourth-cycle client with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). 

Soeurt has fully repaid her past loans and used them wisely to uplift her living conditions. Moreover, she was able to renovate her house. For this new cycle, she and her co-borrower are seeking 1,000,000 KHR and 700,000 KHR. Soeurt is the leader, and she will spend her loan portion to buy an additional boat for her husband and her son to catch more fish for resale. She hopes to gain a good profit to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: To buy an additional boat for her husband and her son to catch more fish for resale

loans.name: Channa's Group

texts.en: Channa is 45 years old, a mother of one son who is working as a paid-worker. She is a widow and a breadwinner of the family who relies on a single business, pig-raising, to overcome the family’s hardship as a single mother. This is the business that she has been engaged in for 11 years, earning about 32,500 KHR per day. This is the third loan for Channa with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner).  After the loan that she has repaid with success, she can support her business better than before. Now, she has formed a group of two to get a new loan from VisionFund  again in the amount of 1,000,000 KHR each. Channa is the leader, and she will spend her loan portion to buy pig feed for her pig-raising business. She hopes that she can expand her business better than before.

loans.use: To buy pig feed for her pig-raising business

loans.name: Burulcha

texts.ru: Бурулче 46 лет, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 2 детей. У Бурулчи - среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Бурулча занимается животноводством, стартовав 7 лет назад, с покупки скота на 5,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Бурулчи, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 1 дойная корова, 1 кобыла, 5 овец, 10 коз. Ежемесячный доход составляет 5,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Бурулча обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку телят для откорма с последующей реализацией на рынке по высокой цене. Доходы от кредита Бурулча планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины.
texts.en: Burulcha is 46 years old, married and raising two children together with her husband.  Burulcha has a secondary education.  To provide the primary source of income for her family, she is involved in animal husbandry, having started 7 years ago with a purchase of livestock with 5,000 som (KGS). Thanks to Burulcha's hard work, today her business contains one dairy cow, one mare, five sheep and ten goats.  The monthly income amounts to 5,000 som (KGS).  In order to further develop her business, Burulcha requested a loan in the amount of 50,000 som (KGS) from the microfinance bank "Bai-Tushum and Partners" to buy calves for fattening up for a subsequent resale at a market at a high price.  Burulcha plans to invest the earnings from the loan into further increasing domestic livestock quantities.

loans.use: to buy calves for fattening up for a subsequent resale

loans.name: Haja

texts.en:
Haja is 36 years old. She is married and has an 18-year-old child who is in school. They all live in Montserrado County which is noted as the commercial city in Liberia. 

Haja is a grade 2 dropout. Seven years now, she has been involved in the sales of dried fish. Most interestingly, she has many customers since she sells quality fish. She started her business with a loan from her husband and she learned this way of selling from her friends. Haja spends 12 hours on her business each day since her house is closer to the local market where she sells. One of the problems she faces is transportation cost. 

Haja is requesting a loan to purchase more dried fish to increase her sales. She plans to open a shop in the near future and to see her child out of college.

loans.use: to purchase more dried fish to increase her sales.

loans.name: Antonio

texts.es:
Antonio  es un joven de 25  años de edad  quien es soltero y vive junto a sus padres en la Aldea Tzununa, Santa Cruz La Laguna, Sololá. 
El es un joven trabajador quien actualmente se dedica a la compraventa de abarrotes en una tienda que tiene a unos metros  de su vivienda. Eligio esta actividad porque sus padres no contaban con los recursos económicos para que pudiera estudiar, es por ello que se  decidió por este oficio que le ha generado buenas ganancias. 
El ha visto que la demanda  de sus clientes es buena así como sus ganancias y necesita tener más variedad de productos  para brindar un mejor servicio a sus clientes.
El solicita un préstamo de Q 8,000.00 para ampliar su tienda comprando más productos para que pueda obtener mejores ganancias, y  seguir creciendo para poder apoyar a su familia en cuanto a los gastos.
Su mayor sueño es construir su vivienda para poder independizarse y así salir adelante.
texts.en:
Antonio is a 25-year-old young man who is single and lives with his parents in the village of Tzununa, Santa Cruz La Laguna, Sololá. He is a hard-working young man who currently makes a living from buying and selling groceries in a store that he has a few meters from his home. He chose this business because his parents didn't have the financial resources for him to be able to study. That is why he decided on this occupation, which has generated good earnings for him.

He has seen that the demand from his customers is good, as are his earnings, and he needs to have a greater variety of products to provide a better service to his customers. He is asking for a loan for 8,000.00 Guatemalan quetzales to expand his store by buying more products in order to obtain better earnings and keep growing so he can support his family with their expenses.

His greatest dream is to build himself a home to become independent and thus get ahead.

loans.use: to buy groceries

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: El cliente vive en casa propia junto a su compañera de vida y su hija,  él se dedica a la elaboración de hamacas de donde proviene su principal fuente de ingresos desde hace 10 años, y además se dedica a realizar trabajos de albañilería, posee muy buenas referencias del sector y de sus vecinos, además posee muy buenas cualidades como responsabilidad, amabilidad y honestidad, posee una clientela establecida que demanda sus servicios como albañil, de esta manera ha logrado solventar muchos de sus gastos familiares, el cliente solicita un crédito para realizar mejoras en su vivienda  como reparación de techo, mejora de infraestructura, etc. pero necesita de capital para comprar todos los materiales necesarios como; hierro, cemento, arena, ladrillos, etc. para poder ofrecerse a su familia un hogar digno donde vivir tranquilamente.
texts.en:
This borrower lives in his own house next to his life partner and his daughter. He makes a living making hammocks; this is where his principal income has been coming from for 10 years. Additionally, he carries out bricklaying work and has very good references in the area and from his neighbors. Furthermore, he has very good qualities like responsibility, friendliness and honesty. He has an established clientele that uses his services like bricklaying. In this way he has achieved affording many of his family expenses.

The borrower is asking for a loan to carry out improvements in his home like roof repair, infrastructure improvement, etc. He needs the capital to buy all of the necessary materials like iron, cement, sand, bricks, etc to be able to offer his family a decent home where they can live peacefully.

loans.use: to buy iron, cement, sand, bricks, etc.

loans.name: Dinara

texts.ru: Динаре 28 лет, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 3 детей. У Динары - среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Динара занимается животноводством, стартовав 5 лет назад, с покупки скота на 2,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Динары, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 1 дойная корова, 2 бычка, 1 теленок, 6 овец. Ежемесячный доход составляет 17,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Динара обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 45,000 сом (KGS) на покупку овец для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Динара планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины.
texts.en: Dinara is 28 years old, married and raising three children together with her husband.  Dinara has a secondary education.  To provide the primary source of income for her family, she is involved in animal husbandry, having started 5 years ago with a purchase of livestock with 2,000 som (KGS).  Thanks to Dinara's hard work, today her business contains one dairy cow, two bulls, one calf and six sheep.  The monthly income amounts to 17,000 som (KGS).  In order to further develop her business, Dinara requested a loan in the amount of 45,000 som (KGS) from the microfinance bank "Bai-Tushum and Partners" to buy sheep in order to increase livestock headcount.  Dinara plans to invest the earnings from the loan into further increasing domestic livestock quantities.

loans.use: to buy sheep in order to increase livestock headcount

loans.name: Ilda

texts.pt:
Ilda, casada, mãe de 2 filhos que frequentam escola em diferentes níveis e vive na casa própria. Para além da sua família sustenta também 3 primos que vivem com ela. 
É comerciante (vende refrigerantes, arroz farinha de milho e outros produtos de primeira necessidade) há mais de quinze anos no quintal da sua casa e no mesmo Espaço físico onde esta instalado a capela da igreja assembleia de deus. 
Com o presente empréstimo de 15.000,00mt pretende adquirir mais produtos para responder a demanda reforçando o seu stock.
Tem como sonho adquirir uma viatura para facilitar o transporte e o principal desafio é a falta de fundos para investir no negócio.
texts.en:
Ilda is married, the mother of 2 children who go to School at different levels and she lives in a house she owns. As well as her family, she also supports 3 cousins who live with her.

She's been a trader out of her back yard (selling sodas, rice, cornflour and other basic products) for more than fifteen years, in the same physical space as the chapel of the Assembleia de Deus church.

With this 15,000.00mt (MZN) loan, she plans to buy more products and respond to demand by increasing her stock.

Her dream is to acquire a vehicle for easy transportation and her main challenge is the lack of funds to invest in her business.

loans.use: buy more products and respond to demand by increasing her stock.

loans.name: Poeurng's Group

texts.en:
Poeurng is 40 years old and a married mother, blessed with four children. Nowadays, only two children rely on her since one of them is in school and the other is too young for schooling. 

For Poeurng's entire family, rice cropping is the main business to generate a decent income to cover food consumption and other necessary expenses. This business has returned her about KHR 30,000 per day.  

This is the original loan for Poeurng with VisionFund Cambodia (Kiva’s partner). As the leader of Poeurng's Group, she will spend her loan portion to buy fertilizer for her farmland. She hopes that she can make more income from her crop husbandry and make more income to sustain her living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her farmland.

loans.name: José Sabino

texts.es:
José cuenta con 50 esta separado de su compañera de viva, pero él tiene la responsabilidad de dos hijos; porque son menores de edad y les ayuda aún. 
Tiene experiencia desde que tenia 8 años de vida y la adquirió con el papá de él,en el rubro de cultivo de maíz, frijol, caña de azúcar, para fabricar el dulce de atado como comúnmente se conoce; también en fletar con bueyes o conocido como carretero. De la casa al trabajo esta a 20 minutos a pie esto es en los cerros o colinas de la misma comunidad. Para comprar los insumos, que necesita para el cultivo del maíz, y caña se traslada a 30 minutos (desvió principal) de allí al pueblo hace 25 minutos. Cuando no se encuentran los productos que busca, en el municipio se traslada al departamento.  
El crédito sera invertido en la compra de un buey,  porque se quedo solo con uno. la razón es que un rayo se lo mato por lo tanto tiene la necesidad de comprar uno para hacer pareja, este se lo compraría a un vecino que solo tiene uno también. Esto le ayudara a continuar realizando los  viajes que hacía, y  los utiliza también para sacar el dulce de atado, y tendrá los ingresos necesarios para ahorrar y pagar el crédito.
A futuro le gustaría trabajar muy fuerte para alcanzar los objetivos propuestos. Las ganancias las utilizaría en darle estudio un poco más a los hijos de él. El sueño de la vida de él, es tener un trapiche propio para sacar el dulce de atado.
texts.en:
José is 50 years old and is separated from his partner, but he is responsible for two children because they are underage and he still helps them. He has experience working from the age of eight; he acquired this with his father, cultivating  corn, beans and sugarcane and making dulce de atado, or evaporated sugarcane candy. He also rents out an ox cart and is known as a wagoner. 

From home to work is a 20 minute walk in the hills of this same community. To buy the supplies that he needs to cultivate corn and sugarcane, he travels 30 minutes away (primary detour). From there to the town takes 25 minutes. When he cannot find the products that he is looking for in the city, he travels to the department. 

The loan will be invested in buying an ox, because he only has one. His other ox was struck by lightning, therefore he needs to buy one to make them a pair. He will buy the ox from a neighbor who only has one as well. This will help him to continue making his trips, and he will also use them to make dulce de atado. He will thus have the income necessary to save money and pay off the loan.

In the future he would like to work very hard to achieve his proposed objectives. He will use his earnings to allow his children to study a bit more. His life dream is to have his own mill to make dulce de atado.

loans.use: to buy an ox

loans.name: Regina

texts.en:
Regina is a married woman, with two children . She lives in a rental house that has piped water and electricity. 

Regina has operated a beauty salon business for the past three months. Her potential customers are women. She dreams of earning more income and building her own house in the future. 

With the KES 30,000 loan, Regina wants to purchase braids, weaves, hair chemicals, hair oil, shampoos, and hair conditioners. She decided to join Yehu Microfinance Trust to get financial support to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase braids, weaves, hair chemicals, hair oil, shampoos, and hair conditioners.

loans.name: Sophorn's Group

texts.en:
Sophorn is 30 years old. She is a citizen from Thmor Koul district of Battambang province where she manages her vegetable garden. She has two children to support since one of them is in school and the other is too young for schooling. 

Sophorn earns a living via cabbage and sweet basil-growing. To supplement her income, her husband works for others, for a fee. 

This is the first loan for Sophorn with VisionFund Cambodia (Kiva’s partner). She leads a group of two to get a new loan. 

As the leader of Sophorn's Group, Sophorn will spend her loan portion to buy seeds and fertilizer for her farmland. She hopes to gain a better yield to improve her lifestyle.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer for her farmland.

loans.name: Pov's Group

texts.en:
Pov, originally from Thbaung Khmum district of Kampong Cham province, is a married mother with three children. Her entire family relies on the decent income received from her one hectare of rice cropping business and a monthly salary from her husband’s job at a construction site. The 20 years of involvement in her current business has returned her about 33,000 KHR per day. 

Pov and the other two joint borrowers are seeking a first-time loan of 1,000,000 KHR each with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner).  As the leader, Pov will spend her loan portion to buy fertilizer and to pay for the plowing fee and transplanting fee. She hopes to support her agribusiness on time and gain a good yield with a high profit.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pay for the plowing fee and transplanting fee.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Ang's Group

texts.en:
Ang is a citizen from Tbaung Khmum district of Kampong Cham province. She is a 32-year-old mother of two schoolchildren. 

For her family, paddy rice farming and working for others for a fee are the main sources of her income. This is the business that she has been involved with for 18 years, earning about KHR 20,000 per day. 

This is Ang's and her co-borrower's first loan with VisionFund Cambodia (Kiva’s partner) with a loan amount of KHR 1,000,000 each. 

As the leader of Ang's Group, Ang will spend her loan portion to buy fertilizer for her crops. She hopes to gain more income from her business, so that she can make more income for her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her crops.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Lam's Group

texts.en:
Lam is 58 years old and a father of five children. Nowadays, two children are studying in a local university. To support his living and his children’s education, he does rice and cassava farming. It is the business that he has had for ages. 

This is a first-time loan for Lam and his co-borrower with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner).  As the leader, Lam will spend his loan portion to buy fertilizer, rice seed, and insecticide for his crop. He hopes this purchase will boost his crop productivity and minimize the loss due to pests.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, rice seed, and insecticide for his crop.

location.town: Siem Reap Province, Srey Snom district

loans.name: Los Capullitos Group

texts.es: El grupo “Los Capullitos” está conformado por 09 personas responsables y dinámicas. Nerea una de las socias de 46 años de edad es casada con 01 hijo, la cual sigue apoyando con sus estudios. Con los deseos de contar con un negocio propio y de esta manera contribuir con los gastos de su hogar Nerea toma la decisión de emprender su negocio, donde actualmente cuenta con una pequeña tienda la cual ofrece prendas de vestir y calzados. Con el fin de seguir surgiendo solicitó el crédito para la compra de casacas, pantalones y calzados. Implementar su tienda es su mayor deseo. “Los Capullitos” está agradecido con los créditos brindados. Nerea se encuentra sentada, es la primera del lado izquierdo y viste chompa color plomo.
texts.en:
The “Los Capullitos” group is formed by nine responsible and dynamic people. Nerea is one of the members. She is 46 years old and is married with one son, who she continues supporting in his studies. With the desire to have a business of her own and thus contribute to her household expenses, Nerea made the decision to launch her business. Currently she has a small store where she sells clothing and shoes. In order to keep emerging she is asking for the loan to buy jackets, pants and shoes. Her greatest desire is to establish her store.

The “Los Capullitos” group is grateful for the loans provided. Nerea is seated; she is the first woman on the left side and is wearing a lead-colored sweater.

loans.use: to buy jackets, pants and shoes.

loans.name: Theavy

texts.en:
Theavy is 37 years old and a villager from Takeo province. She strives for a living to support her three children who are in school. She does this through two hectares of rice cropping, Khmer noodle-selling, and a pig-raising business. It is the business that she has had for ages.

This is not the first loan for Theavy with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She has fully repaid her past loan wisely to support her living and to send her children to university level. Now, she is seeking a new loan to pay the tuition fee for her son, who is pursuing his bachelor’s degree in Phnom Penh, specializing in information technology. 

She hopes that this loan will financially support her son’s education cost on time, so that he can pay attention in his studies and get a good job after graduation.

loans.use: to pay the tuition fee for her son.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary works hard to support her family. Mary is married and has been selling refined rice, noodles, and gari (a product made from cassava) in Ghana.

Mary is requesting a GHS 1,200 loan through ID Ghana to purchase more refined rice, noodles, and gari to sell to customers. Mary has been in this business for five years now.

In the future, Mary would like to save enough money, so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more refined rice, noodles, and gari (a product made from cassava) to sell to customers.

loans.name: Luz

texts.es: Luz tiene 34 años de edad, es madre soltera de una hija con quien vive en su casa propia. Luz se dedica a la venta de pescado fresco,y tiene 10 años de experiencia en este rubro, al principio ayudaba a su cuñada en este tipo de negocio pero al ver que era rentable, reunió un capital para independizarse y formar su propio negocio, no tuvo problema con el negocio ya que contaba con los conocimientos necesarios, hoy en día trabaja con clientes ya conocidos quienes siempre le compran sus productos. Este es su primer crédito con Kiva y se siente agradecida por el apoyo financiero que recibe para seguir adelante, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual. El dinero solicitado de S/.1500.00 está destinado para la compra de pescado fresco.
texts.en:
Luz is 34 years old and is a single mother with a daughter she lives with in a house they own. Luz makes a living by selling fresh fish, and she has ten years of experience with this work. Initially she helped her sister-in-law with this type of business, but upon seeing that it was profitable, she gathered capital to become independent and form her own business. She didn't have any problems with the business, as she already had the necessary knowledge. Today she works with customers she already knows and who always buy her products. 

This is her first loan with Kiva and she feels grateful for the financial support that she is receiving to get ahead. She also commits to making her payments in a punctual manner. The requested amount of 1,500.00 Peruvian nuevos soles is designated for buying fresh fish.

loans.use: to buy fish wholesale

loans.name: Jose Antonio

texts.es: Don José vive en casa propia junto a su compañera de vida, él se dedica al cultivo de maíz, maicillo, y frijol desde hace varios años, gracias a la ventas de sus cultivos logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, es una persona muy dedicada a sus labores, además honesto y responsable, sus servicios son muy demandados en la zona, gracias a esto posee una clientela establecida, de esta manera ha logrado solventar muchos de sus gastos, Don José solita un crédito para la compra de insumos agrícolas para el cultivo de frijol  como semillas, fertilizantes, abonos, herbicidas, herramientas etc. Y así poder seguir cosechando, obtener mayores ingresos y mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
José lives in a house he owns with his life partner. He has made a living by cultivating corn, sorghum and beans for many years. Thanks to the sales of his crops, he manages to cover some of his household expenses. He is someone who is very dedicated to his work, and he is also honest and responsible. His services are in high demand in the area; thanks to this he has a well-established clientele. In this way he has been able to pay many of his expenses. 

José is asking for a loan to be able to buy agricultural supplies for the cultivation of beans, such as seeds, fertilizers, manure, herbicides, tools, etc. In this way he will be able to keep harvesting, obtain greater earnings and improve his quality of life.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers, manure, herbicides, tools, etc.

loans.name: Sinat

texts.en: Sinat is 38 years old and a married father blessed with three little children. To tackle with his family hardship, he does rice cropping on four hectares area and produces concrete pipe for resale. He has engaged in his current business for six years. This is the first microloan for Sinat with VisionFund (Kiva’s Field Partner).  He is seeking a new loan to buy herbicide for his farmland. Moreover, he will use a portion of this loan to buy materials to make more concrete pipe including cement, sand etc. He hopes to gain a good income from his business so he can set aside some money to send his kids to school.

loans.use: To buy herbicide for his farmland

loans.name: Maria Victoria

texts.es: Doña Maria vive en casa propia, junto a sus 2 hijos y su nieto, ella posee una tienda desde hace varios años, de donde obtiene muy buenos ingresos, su negocio es muy demandado gracias a la amabilidad con que atiende a sus clientes y la atención que les brinda, además a la calidad de sus productos, posee una clientela ya establecida, es una persona responsable y educada, de esta manera ha logrado solventar muchos de sus gastos familiares, Doña Maria solicita un crédito para invertir en la tienda en la compra de granos básicos, golosinas, sopas, detergentes, etc. y de esta manera mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en: Doña Maria lives in her own home with her two children and her grandson.  She has had a small store for a number of years.  She earns very good income from her store, which is in great demand thanks to her friendly customer service and the quality of the products she sells.  Doña Maria has an established clientele.  She is a responsible and educated person, and therefore has managed to cover many of her family's expenses.  Doña Maria is requesting a loan in order to invest in her store by purchasing basic grains, sweets, soups, detergents etc. and in that way improve her quality of life and that of her family.

loans.use: to purchase basic grains, sweets, soups, detergents etc.

loans.name: Jacoba Anita

texts.es: Doña Jacoba es una persona muy responsable y emprendedora, vive en casa propia, junto a su madre, dos hijos, nuera y nieto, ella posee una tienda desde hace varios años, tiene mucha clientela pues tiene variedad de productos y a muy buenos precios, con lo que obtiene de su negocio logra solventar algunos gastos de su familia, Doña Jacoba solicita un crédito para la compra de mercadería para su tienda como: azúcar, café, granos básicos, sopas, aceites, refrescos, etc.  con esto espera brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida
texts.en: Doña Jacoba is a very responsible and enterprising person.  She lives in her own home with her mother, her two children, her daughter-in-law and her grandson.  She has had a store for a number of years.  She has a large clientele, as she offers a variety of products at very good prices.  With what doña Jacoba earns from her business, she manages to cover some of the family's expenses.  Doña Jacoba is requesting a loan in order to purchase merchandise for her store, like: sugar, coffee, basic grains, soups, cooking oils, sodas etc.  In doing so, she hopes to offer her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase sugar, coffee, basic grains, soups, cooking oils, sodas etc.

loans.name: Luis Miguel

texts.es:
Luis Miguel de 21 años, es un joven estudiante de psicología en una universidad local
Luis Miguel ha solicitado su segundo crédito con la finalidad de seguir estudiando para lograr terminar su carrera, en la actualidad está cursando la mitad de sus estudios se siente feliz por este apoyo económico que le servirá para pagar la matrícula y mensualidades de un nuevo ciclo en la universidad. Luis Miguel está agradecido a los inversionistas de KIVA por este nuevo préstamo que le permite seguir adelante, su trabajo en el mercado solo le permite cubrir los gastos para sus materiales de estudios y movilidad por eso es muy importante para el contar con este apoyo.
texts.en:
Luis Miguel is 21 years old. He is a young student of psychology at a local university. He has requested his second loan with the objective of continuing to study to complete his degree. Currently, he is taking courses for half of his studies. He feels happy for this economic support that will allow him to pay for enrollment and monthly frees in a new cycle of the university. 

Luis Miguel  is thankful to the Kiva investors for this new loan that will allow him to move forward. His work in the market only allows him to cover the costs of his study materials and commuting. For this reason it is very important to have this support.

loans.use: to pay for enrollment and monthly fees at the university.

loans.name: Porfirio

texts.es:
Don Porfirio de 72 años de edad, es viudo con 6 hijos de 40, 37, 34, 33,28 y 26 años de edad.  No tiene ningún nivel académico, solamente un hijo y un nieto viven con él.

Se dedica a la agricultura desde que tenía 8 años de edad, el abuelo fue quien lo inculco a la agricultura. Viaja un kilómetro desde su casa hasta el lugar de trabajo, él en ocasiones viaja en bicicleta o si no a pie, el nieto de 24 años es el que le ayuda en el trabajo de la agricultura

El préstamo que esta solicitando a  Fundación Campo, es para comprar abono y herbicidas para fertilizar los cultivos y darle un buen mantenimiento a la tierra para los buenos frutos del cultivo.

Los sueños que don Porfirio tiene, es disponer de un buen cultivo y ganancias en los granas, para llevarlos al hogar y también obtener ganancias cuando venda una parte.
texts.en:
Don Porfirio is 72-years old.  He is a widow with six children who are 40, 37, 34, 33,28 and 26 years old respectively.  He has had no schooling.  Only one son and one grandson live with him. 

Don Porfirio makes his living in agriculture, which he starting learning from his grandfather when he was 8-years old.  He travels one kilometer from his house to the area where he works.  Sometimes he gets there on his bike, other times by foot.  His 24-year old grandson is the one who helps him with his agricultural work. 

The loan that Don Porfirio is requesting from Fundación Campo is for the purchase of compost and herbicides to fertilize his crop and maintain his land so it will give a good crop.

The dreams don Porfirio has are to prepare for a good crop and profit from the seeds; to bring them home and also to earn a profit when he sells a part.

loans.use: to purchase compost and herbicides to fertilize his crop and maintain the land to have a good crop.

loans.name: Danaya Group

texts.fr:
Les cinq membres du groupe  DANAYA  sont des femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 40 ans, et ont en moyenne 4 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des familles monogamiques au quartier Médine de Sikasso 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles sont à leur onzième prêt avec l’institution de micro finance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle. 
Mme  BINTOU  au milieu sur la photo fait le commerce de pagnes et de tissus.
Elle compte acheter avec son  prêt 70  mètres de pagne, 30 pagnes qu’elle revendra en détail au grand marché ainsi qu’à la maison à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes au comptant. 
 Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 20 000 francs CFA dont une partie est  utilisée  pour payer le prêt et son interêt et l’autre pour son épargne.
texts.en:
The five members of the DANAYA group are married women who are, on average, 40 years old and also have an average of four children each.  Most of these women live in monogamous families in the Médine neighborhood of the city of Sikasso (third adminitrative region of Mali).

They are on their eleventh loan with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso, and they are taking this loan to meet the needs of their customers.

Bintou sells pagnes (colorful West-African fabrics) and other fabrics.  In the photo, she is the woman standing in the middle of the group.

She plans to use her loan to buy 70 meters of fabric to make 30 pagnes which she will resell on a retail basis at the Grand Market and from home.  Her customer base consists of men and women who pay her in cash.

Bintou is expecting to make an average monthly profit of 20,000 CFA francs, part of which will be used to repay her loan and the interest, while the extra money will be put into savings.

loans.use: to buy some "pagnes" and fabrics.

loans.name: Susan Pamela

texts.es:
Susan  cursa el segundo año de  la carrera de contabilidad en un Instituto  local
Ella decidió estudiar esta carrera porque es muy rentable y tiene vocación, le va muy bien con sus estudios a los que le  dedica 8 horas diarias, por otro lado está trabajando como auxiliar contable en una empresa particular algo que considera muy importante para el desarrollo de su carrera. Susan ha solicitado este préstamo para poder obtener su titulo en contabilidad y realizar la sustentación del mismo, su mayor anhelo es culminar sus estudios con éxito y trabajar en una entidad bancaria, Susan esta agradecida por el apoyo que recibe de todos los inversionistas que ayudan a jóvenes como ella.
texts.en: Susan is in the second year of training to be an accountant, studying at a local institute. She decided to study this career because it is very well-paying and she has a vocation for it. Things are going well for her in her studies and she spends 8 hours every day studying. In addition she is working as an accounting assistant in a private business, which she considers to be very important for her career development. Susan has sought this loan in order to be able to obtain her degree in accounting and be able to support it. Her greatest wish is to finish her studies successfully and work in a banking enterprise. Susan is grateful for the support that she is receiving from all the investors who help young people like herself.

loans.use: to pay educational fees

loans.name: Dhirgham

texts.en:
Dhirgham is 29 years old, married, and has one child. Dhirgham works hard to provide his family’s income all by himself. Dhirgham owns a cafe where he provide coffee, tea and food to the customers. He established his business in 2000 and has gained good experience in this field. Dhirgham now has two employees to help him run the cafe.

Dhirgham is requesting a loan of 3,000 USD. He will use this loan to purchase a chicken grill machine and a food display counter. Dhirgham aims to grow his business and increase his profits so he can provide better service and open a new cafe near the river.

The story of Dhirgham and his business is just one of the many examples for Izdiharona for Economic Development clients who have been able to improve their business.

loans.use: to purchase a chicken grill machine and a food display counter.

loans.name: Hussien

texts.en:
Hussien is a 33-year-old married man and a father of one child. He has been working in an agriculture sector for six years. He specializes in growing palm trees and selling dates. Hussien takes good care of his production and makes sure that every tree has the care it needs to ensure high quality production.

Hussien will use this loan to purchase organic fertilizers and renovate his farm.  

He expects that the loan will generate additional income that will enable him to buy calves and develop his farm to give a good life to his family.

The story of Hussien and his farm is just one of the many examples of Izdiharona for Economic Development’s clients.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizers and renovate his farm.

loans.name: Nadia

texts.en:
Nadia is 54 years old and is a government employee. Her son Muhamed is a college student majoring in economics and management. He was late in his study because of the family's low income. Every year the family faces the problem of making ends meet at the beginning of the study year for the additional expenses of college fees and books. With this loan now he can accommodate all these expenses and plan after graduation to start his own business.

Nadia is requesting a loan to pay for her son's annual tuition fees and other college expenses. Muhamed's vision is to earn a master degree in the future. 

The story of Muhamed is just one of the many examples of Izdiharona for Economic Development clients that are able to get better education.

loans.use: to pay for her son's college tuition.

loans.name: Perry

texts.en: Perry is a married woman with three children whose dream has always been getting rich. She could not afford to look for jobs because she lacked formal employment. She therefore resiliently resorted to cattle keeping which is paying off slowly and she is confident that soon her dream will come true. She wants the loan to buy more cows that she breeds for a defined period of 3 to 6 months and then sells at a higher price. She thanks Kiva through Ugafode for giving them cheap loans. The gentleman in the photo is her son who also signed the waiver form.

loans.use: To buy cows

loans.name: Ines

texts.es: La Sra. Ines  sigue con la misma actividad ella  es agricultora desde hace ya bastante tiempo, cuenta que le fue bien con el anterior crédito ya que lo utilizo en la compra de semillas para la siembra de zanahoria, en esta ocasión solicita el crédito para la siembra de papa también comprara semillas y para el preparado de la tierra, se siente feliz y agradecida por la oportunidad que le brindan ya que está creciendo y mejorando su actividad.
texts.en:
Ines continues to work in the same business. She has been a farmer for a long time. She reports that her previous loan went very well and that she used it to buy seeds to plant carrots.

This time, she requests a loan to plant potatoes. She will also buy seeds and prepare her land.

She is happy and thankful for the opportunity provided to her since she is growing and improving her business,

loans.use: To plant potatoes and prepare her fields.

loans.name: Ra's Group

texts.en: Age 55 and a villager from Battambang provinces’ Thmor Koul district, Ra is a mother of five children. Nowadays, only two kids are in school and need her support. For the sake of her family, she and her husband do rice cropping on two hectares; it is the business that she has had for 10 years. This is the first microloan for Ra with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She leads a group consisting of three female borrowers including her. Ra and one of her co-borrowers are seeking for 200,000 KHR each while the remaining member is applying for 400,000 KHR. As the leader, she will spend her loan portion to buy herbicide for her farmland. She hopes to remove the weeds from her farmland so she can gain a good yield with more profit. She hopes to keep her kids in school until tertiary level.

loans.use: To buy herbicide for her farmland

loans.name: Chanrith's Group

texts.en: A young father of one little kid residing in Moung Russey district of Battambang province, Chanrith strives for a living via rice farming on three and half hectares of farmland. This paddy farming has returned him about 20,000 KHR per day. After offsetting other necessary expenses, he can save about 10,000 KHR for future needs. Chanrith is in his second borrowing cycle while his joint borrower is in the first cycle with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). The past loan, which he has repaid completely, has relieved his family’s burden better than before. Now, he is asking for 200,000 KHR whilst his fellow group member is applying for 300,000 KHR. As the leader, he will spend his loan portion to buy fertilizer for his crop. He hopes to boost his crop output and make more income for his family.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for his crop

loans.name: Naira

texts.en:
Naira is 43 years old, she is divorced and now she lives in Vanadzor city. Several years ago Naira lived with her family in the city of Spitak in the Lori region, happily and in a very nice house. The house was destroyed by an awful and severe earthquake in 1988, which left the people not only without houses, but unfortunately without their relatives and family members as well. However, Naira continues to live with her three children (two daughters and a son), her mother and grandmother. But the house where they live is a half-built house with bad living conditions. Her elder daughter is married and she lives in the Russian Federation. Naira’s son is in military service and her smallest daughter is still school-aged. Naira works at a small restaurant, which organizes wedding and birthday parties, and she works here as a cook.

Naira asks a loan of 600.000 Armenian drams to buy some furniture for her house and she also wants to buy a computer in order to speak with her daughter living abroad.

loans.use: To buy furniture and a computer for her house.

loans.name: Jaime David

texts.es:
Jaime  es estudiante  de Administración de Negocios Internacionales
Jaime  lleva 4 años estudiando y  lo que más desea es culminar su carrera para  especializarse en su profesión. Le va muy bien con sus estudios  a pesar que la parte económica es un gran obstáculo, uno de sus sueños es tener su propia empresa de comercio internacional, este nuevo crédito le permitirá pagar la matrícula y mensualidades de un nuevo ciclo en la universidad, de esa manera continuara estudiando con tranquilidad y podrá culminar sus estudios. Jaime se siente afortunado y agradecido por recibir esta ayuda.
texts.en:
Jaime is studying International Business Administration. Jaime has been studying for 4 years and his greatest desire is to finish his degree so that he can specialize in his profession. His studies are going very well, although the financial aspect is a great obstacle.

One if his dreams is to own his own international commerce business. This loan will allow him to pay the registration fee and monthly payments for the new school year. This way, he can keep studying calmly and he will be able to finish his degree. Jaime feels fortunate and is thankful to be receiving this assistance.

loans.use: to pay registration fees and monthly payments.

loans.name: Allakabo Group

texts.fr:
Les six  membres du groupe    ALLAKABO  sont essentiellement de femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 40 ans, et ont en moyenne 4 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des familles monogamiques à  Loulouni un des villages de Sikasso 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles sont à leur troisième prêt avec l’institution de micro finance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle. 
Mme FATOUMATA en position assise 1 ère à droite fait le commerce de  fruits, légumes et condiments.
Elle compte acheter avec son  prêt 3 cartons de cube maggi, 1 panier de poivre, 1 panier de soumbala et le reste dans du sel qu’elle revendra en détail au marché, à Sikasso  à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes au comptant. 
Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 15 000 francs CFA dont une partie est  utilisée  pour payer le prêt et son interêt et l’autre pour son épargne.
texts.en:
The majority of the six members of the ALLAKABO group are married women who are, on average, 40 years old and also have an average of four children each. Most of these women live in monogamous families in Loulouni, a village located in the Sikasso region (third adminitrative region of Mali).

They are on their third loan with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso, and they are taking this loan to meet the needs of their customers.

Fatoumata sells fruits, vegetables and condiments.  In the photo, she is in the front row, first from the right. 

She plans to use her loan to buy three packages of Maggi bouillon cubes, one basket of pepper, one basket of soumbala (a condiment prepared from néré seeds) and also some salt.  She will resell her goods on a retail basis at the market and in Sikasso. Her customer base consists of men and women who pay her in cash.

Fatoumata is expecting to make an average monthly profit of 15,000 CFA francs, part of which will be used to repay her loan and the interest, while the extra money will be put into savings.

loans.use: to buy condiments.

loans.name: Jorge

texts.es: Jorge  tiene 57 años de edad, está casado y vive en su casa propia junto a su esposa y sus dos nietos. Jorge es un hombre muy trabajador y se dedica a la venta de productos comestibles y como  actividad complementaria se dedica a brindar el servicio de transporte urbano en su mototaxi .Jorge comienza  el  negocio de la venta de productos comestibles al por menor cuando decide vender sus dos mulas, el dinero que recibio lo invintió en la compra de algunos productos, hoy en día trabaja con los prestamos financieros que le ayudaron a seguir creciendo, El problema que tenía antes de tener el negocio fue la muerte de su hijo el cual lo enfermo emocionalmente, pero despues de algunos meses logro superarlo ya que desea sacar adelante a sus nietos. Gracias a esta actividad mejoro la calidad de vida de su familia. Este es su primer crédito con Kiva y se siente agradecido por el apoyo financiero que recibe para seguir adelante, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual. Con el monto solicitado de S/.1500.00 Jorge comprará productos comestibles tales como arroz, azúcar, leche , entre otros.
texts.en:
Jorge is 57 years old, married, and lives in his own home with his wife and two grandchildren, Jorge is a very hardworking man and makes a living selling food products. As a supplemental activity, he provides transportation services on his mototaxi. 

Jorge started his grocery store when he decided to sell his two mules. He invested the money that he made by purchasing some products. Now, he works with loans that help him to continue to grow his business. 

A problem that he faced before he started his business was the death of his son, which deeply affected him emotionally. After a few months, he overcame it because he wanted to move forward with his grandchildren. 

Thanks to this business, he improved his family's quality of life. This is his first Kiva loan and he is grateful for the financial support that he has received to move forward. He promises to make his monthly payments on time. With the loan of 1,500 nuevos soles, Jorge will buy food products like rice, sugar, milk, etc.

loans.use: to buy food products like rice, sugar, milk, etc.

loans.name: Gayane

texts.en:
Gayane is from Akner village where she lives with her husband and two little children (her daughter is in the photo).  Gayane's husband works at a local company.  Gayane does not work, as she has to take care of her children, but she has been involved in the farming business for 5 years.  Gayane owns a plot of land where she cultivates haricot, potato, onion, and garlic.  She sells the gathered harvest to local retailers who come and take the harvest from her house.  As there are only a few tractors in the whole community, locals have to rent it from tractor owners in order to organize the cultivation process.  Gayane also needs to rent a tractor to start autumn sowing.  For doing this she needs to purchase fuel and, unfortunately, she has insufficient funds.    

This hard working woman with good credit history requests 3,000 USD to pay for fuel and fertilizer, which is very important for the successful cultivation of the land.  Gayane plans to purchase a large amount of fuel to receive a 20% discount and to keep it for the whole season.

Gayane hopes for lenders' support.

loans.use: to pay for fuel and fertilizer.

loans.name: Maima

texts.en: Maima is 35 years old and married with two children, ages 11 and 14 years old.  Her children are in school and they all live in Montserrado County, which is the capital and number one commercial city in Liberia.  For five years she has been running her own cook shop, selling rice and soup.  She has more customers and makes more profit every day.  She started her business with money from her husband, a businessman, and she learned this way of selling from her friends.  She spends eight hours on her business each day.  She is requesting a loan to purchase more rice, pepper, oil, vita, and other items to expand her business.  She plans to expand her business even more and to educate her children.

loans.use: to purchase more rice, pepper, oil, vita, etc.

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
Eunice is a 24-year-old woman married to Kennedy.  She is a mother of two children.  Eunice sells secondhand clothes in Kangemi and has been in this business for four years.  She earns a monthly income of fifteen thousand shillings.

This will be Eunice's second loan with KADET LTD.  She plans to buy new clothes for resale.  In future, she wants to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy new clothes to sell.

loans.name: Joyce's Group

texts.en:
Doris was born in 1968 but is still determined to work until she gets her dream in life. She is a member of this group, which is located in the southern part of Teshie-Ghana. She has so far borrowed four loan cycles from ID-Ghana through its Teshie branch and has now applied for a loan of GHS 800 to be able to boost her business by buying soft drinks (Fanta, Coca-Cola), cooking oil and noodles. She is an enterprising lady who has seen her business grow from one level to another since 2000. Her clients are mainly people from the nearby locality and the locals of Teshie. Doris is hard working and honest and this has helped her a lot to grow the business despite the challenges of inflation and competition. She believes that the profit from the business will help her achieve her dream in life.

The other colleague sells fish and together they need a total amount of GHS 1800 to improve their businesses.

loans.use: To buy soft drinks, cooking oil and noodles for her business.

loans.name: Safani

texts.en:
Safani is 50 years old and married with 4 children. He makes tents and bouncing castles for children. His wife also provides additional income to support the family. He has been in this business for the past 26 years and it has been profitable.

He will use this loan amount to buy material for making the bouncing castles and tents for selling. He intends to use the generated income to build a house on his plot of land. This is his fourth loan term from KADET LTD. 

Safani hopes to grow his business and be able to educate his children as well as improve the living standards of his family.

loans.use: To buy more material for making bouncing castles.

loans.name: Allakagni Group

texts.fr:
Les sept  membres du groupe    ALLAKAGNI  sont  essentiellement de femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 40 ans, et ont en moyenne 4 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des familles monogamiques à  Loulouni un des villages de Sikasso 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles sont à leur septième prêt avec l’institution de micro finance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle. 
Mme    BATOGOMA en position assise à l’extrême droite fait le commerce de  fruits et légumes.
Elle compte acheter avec son  prêt environ 10 régimes de bananes, 5 paniers d’orange qu’elle revendra en détail au marché  et à Sikasso  à une place fixe à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes au comptant. 
Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 20 000 francs CFA dont une partie est  utilisée  pour payer le prêt et son interêt et l’autre pour son épargne .
texts.en:
The majority of the seven members of the ALLAKAGNI group are married women who are, on average, 40 years old and also have an average of four children each. Most of these women live in monogamous families in Loulouni, a village located in the Sikasso region (third adminitrative region of Mali).

They are on their seventh loan with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso, and this loan will help them to meet the needs of their customers.

Batogoma, one of the group's members, sells fruits and vegetables.  In the photo, she is in the front row, first from the right.

She plans to use her loan to buy ten bunches of bananas and five baskets of oranges which she will resell on a retail basis at the market and in Sikasso, in a fixed location. Her customer base consists of men and women who pay her in cash.

Batogoma is expecting to make an average monthly profit of 20,000 CFA francs, part of which will be used to repay her loan and the interest, while the extra money will be put into savings.

loans.use: to buy fruits.

loans.name: Yeny

texts.es: Yeny  es una joven estudiante de 20 años de edad, ella estudia la carrera de educación en una Universidad local, en la actualidad estudia y trabaja como auxiliar de educación en una escuela de su sector, esto le permite ir desarrollando su carrera y ganar experiencia.Yeny ha solicitado este préstamo para poder pagar las mensualidades de la universidad y comprar algunos materiales de estudio, esta agradecida a los prestamistas de KIVA  por ayudar a personas como ella.
texts.en:
Yeny is a 20-year-old student. She studies education at the local university. Currently, she studies and works as a teacher's assistant at a school in her sector. This allows her to develop her career and gain experience.

Yeny requests this loan to make monthly tuition payments to the university and to buy some school materials. She is grateful to Kiva lenders for helping people like her.

loans.use: to make monthly tuition payments.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah is a 25-year-old married woman with one child (1yr old).  Sarah has a milk shop and distributes milk in Nairobi.  She has been in this business for 6 years. 

She will use the loan to expand her business by buying more fresh milk to sell.  She will use the anticipated profits to repay her loan and to improve the standards of the business.  Having successfully repaid her first loan, this will be her 2nd loan with KADET LTD. 

Sarah hopes to be successful in her business, to educate her child, to be self-reliant, and to be successful in life and in her family.

loans.use: to buy fresh milk.

loans.name: Baslisa

texts.en:
Baslisa is a single mother of five children.  She sells groceries in Kangemi and has been doing so for thirteen years.  She earns a monthly income of fifteen thousand shillings.

This will be Baslisa's second loan with KADET LTD.  She plans to use the entire amount to buy groceries for her store.  In the future, she wants to educate her children and to improve their living standards.

loans.use: to purchase tomatoes, onions, and potatoes for her store.

loans.name: Mwanapili

texts.en:
Mwanapili is married with five school-going children.  They live at their own house that is without electricity or piped water.  Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Mwanapili has operated a fruit and vegetable stall for the past five years.  She sells from home to her neighbors.  She dreams of establishing a mini green grocer in the future.  With the 25,000 KES she wants to purchase bales of green vegetables, onions, potatoes, and tomatoes to sell.  She decided to join Yehu to get financial support.

loans.use: to purchase bales of green vegetables, onions, potatoes, and tomatoes for resale.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a 39-year-old married woman with 3 children.  Her children are in school and range in age between 12 and 19 years old.  They all live in Montserrado County, which is the capital and number one commercial city in Liberia. 

Mary stopped her education at grade 3.  For nine years, she has been involved in the sale of sweet-potatoes-greens.  She enjoys the flow of her many customers.  She started her business with a loan from her husband, and she learned this way of selling from her friends.  She spends eight hours each day on her business.  Low income is the biggest challenge that she face in her business since she does not have enough money to meet her customer’s range.  She is requesting a loan to purchase more sweet-potatoes-greens for her business.  She plans to expand her business even more and to educate her children.

loans.use: to purchase more sweet-potatoes-greens for her business.

loans.name: Richard

texts.en:
Richard is a 34-year-old, industrious gentleman.  He is married to Mercy, who brings additional income to the family through her milk-selling business.  Richard is a father of four children who are between the ages of 3 and 9 years old.  He earns a living through livestock rearing and selling where he makes approximately 28,000 KES per month.  He learned about KADET from a loan officer who was carrying out a marketing campaign in his area of operation.  He has chosen to diversify into the motorcycle transport business, which is a booming business in his local area.

Richard has acquired his first loan of 91,065 KES, which will help him to purchase a new motorcycle.  He will use the increased proceeds to pay school fees for his children and to repay his loan.

His hope is to bring up a wealthy and well-educated family.

loans.use: to purchase a motorcycle.

loans.name: Eva

texts.es: Eva tiene 34 años de edad, está casada y tiene una hija con la que vive en su casa propia. Su actividad principal se centra en la agricultura ya que se dedica a la siembra, producción  y venta de granos de cacao y plátano tiene un promedio de 15 años en está actividad.  El principal problema en esta actividad es la fuerte variación que sufre el precio del cacao y plátano. Pero gracias a su experiencia y a sus conocimientos ha logrado sacar adelante su producción lo que ahora espera obtener otros terrenos de cultivo y así mismo cambiar la producción normal por una producción de cacao con certificación orgánica para ofrecer un mejor producto.Este es su primer crédito con Kiva y se siente agradecida por el apoyo financiero que recibe para seguir adelante, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual. Con el dinero solicitado de S/.1000 soles comprará abono orgánico para mejorar su producción.
texts.en: Eva is 34 years old, married and has one daughter, with whom she lives in her own house.  Eva mainly makes a living in farming as she sows, grows and sells cacao and bananas.  She has been doing this work for around 15 years.  The main problem with this work is the great fluctuations in the prices of the crops.  However, thanks to her experience and knowledge, Eva has been able to move forward with her products and she now hopes to buy more land and start to produce certified, organic cacao.  She will then be able to offer a better product.  This is Eva's first Kiva loan and she is very grateful for this financial support.  She promises to make her repayments punctually.  Eva will use the 1000 Nuevo Soles to buy organic manure in order to improve production.

loans.use: to buy organic manure.

loans.name: San Sebastian - 32 Group

texts.es: El Banco de emprendimiento SAN SEBASTIAN - 32  está  compuesto por ocho integrantes, siete mujeres y dos varones,  la presidenta del banco es la Sra. Carol,  tiene 46 casada, ella se dedica a la  venta de comida en su puesto de venta que se encuentra   en la zona de la Isla del Sol de la ciudad de Cochabamba,  este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, la Sra. Carol utilizara este préstamo para la compra de insumos para la elaboración de comida como papa, arroz y fideo al por mayor  y así de esta manera mejorar sus ventas e incrementar su capital de trabajo su razón para solicitar este préstamo es la falta de capital para la compra de insumos, la Sra. Carol va a utilizar los beneficios para seguir comprando cantidad de insumos,  su deseo de la Sra. Carol es crecer en su negocio, es una persona trabajadora se siente feliz y agradecida con la institución por el apoyo que le brindan en la otorgación del crédito.
texts.en: The "San Sebastian - 32" communal bank is made up of eight members - six women and two men.  The bank's president is 46-year-old Carol.  She is married and makes a living selling meals from her stall in the Isla del Sol area of the city of Cochabamba.  This is Carol's first loan cycle with the communal bank and she will use it to buy supplies in bulk,  such as potatoes, rice and pasta, to make the meals,.  With these supplies she will be able to improve her sales and increase her working capital.  Carol chose to apply for this loan because of her lack of supplies.  Carol will use her profits to continue buying supplies.  Carol's wish is to expand her business.  She is hard-working and is happy and grateful for the support being provided with this loan.

loans.use: to buy supplies in order to prepare meals.

loans.name: Lendrosh

texts.en:
Lendrosh was born in the village of Srashen, in the Syunik region.  After school, Lendrosh studied at the Kapan Constructional College.  For many years he worked at different companies where he did construction.  But, after he returned to his native village, he became engaged in farming and agriculture. Lendrosh is married and has two daughters and a son.  His daughters are already married and live separately and his son is still school-aged.  

Together with his wife, Lendrosh breeds two cows, a calf, three piglets, and twenty chickens.  On their plot of land they cultivate cereal.  Little by little, Lendrosh teaches his son the details and skills of farming and agriculture.  He thinks that whatever happens and whatever profession his son will choose in the future, Lendrosh hopes that his son will be close to land, nature, and animals that need care and love.

Lendrosh asks for a loan of 1,000,000 Armenian drams to buy a truck and to organize hay-mowing activities.  This will help him to receive a good profit from his agricultural business.

loans.use: to buy a truck and to organize hay-mowing activities.

loans.name: Seymur

texts.en:
Seymur is considered to be a hardworking and responsible person.  He has been a carpenter for ten years and runs his business out of his home.  As he will have the opportunity, he wants to build a workshop in the yard of his house to avoid renting space.  He repairs sofas and chairs.  He has customers because he does good work and has good prices. 

Seymur lives with his wife and two children in a house with poor living conditions.  He is asking for a loan to start home repair and to improve his family’s quality of life.

loans.use: to start home repair.

loans.name: Makhir

texts.en: Makhir was born in 1971. He has two grown children who are 15 and 17 years old. He is a security guard at a local company. He receives a monthly salary of 200 AZN. To support his family's nutrition and education, he is engaged in farming. He sells vegetables, fruits and dairy products. Makhir can confidently say that every year his business is doing well in spite of the fact that the profitability of these activities depends on the weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. He is seeking the loan to buy manure, sprinklers, fungicide, and fertilizer so that he can continue to provide good care for his crops and get a high-quality harvest. He will be able to sell the produce for a better price in the market and increase his income.

loans.use: to buy manure, sprinklers, fungicide, and fertilizer.

loans.name: Raquel

texts.es: Raquel tiene 31 años de edad, es madre soltera de dos hijos con quienes vive en su casa propia. Su actividad económica se centra en la agricultura por está razón cultiva cacao y café orgánico, además cuenta con 10 años de experiencia . En sus inicios tuvo muchas dificultades ya que no contaban con el dinero suficiente para adquirir los terrenos pero gracias al apoyo de su padre logró  adquirir los terrenos y comenzar a realizar los sembríos. Con la ganancia de su cosecha logra sacar adelante a su familia. Este es su primer préstamo con Kiva y se siente agradecida por el apoyo financiero que recibe para seguir adelante, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual. El dinero solicitado de S/.1500.00, lo invertirá en el mantenimiento de su cultivos de cacao con la compra de abono orgánico.
texts.en: Raquel is 31 years old.  She is a single mother to two children, who live with her in her own house.  Raquel makes a living in farming, growing cacao and organic coffee.  She has ten years experience in this field.  In the beginning Raquel had many difficulties as she did not have enough many to buy any land.  However, thanks to her father's support, she managed to buy land and began sowing her crops.  Raquel is is able to use her profits to help her family to prosper.  This is Raquel's first loan with Kiva and she is very grateful for the financial support that she is receiving in order to get ahead.  She promises to make her repayments on time.  Raquel will use the 1500 Nuevo Soles to invest in maintaining her cacao crops by buying organic manure.

loans.use: to buy organic manure for her crops.

loans.name: Las Unidas - 32 Group

texts.es: El Banco de emprendimiento  LAS UNIDAS - 32  está  compuesto por ocho integrantes, siete mujeres y un varón   la presidenta del banco es la Sra. Mariela,  ella se se dedica a la venta de variedad de refrescos en su puesto de venta que se encuentra en un mercado muy concurrido de la ciudad de Cochabamba,  este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, la Sra. Mariela va a usar este préstamo para la compra variedad de refrescos por mayor para surtir su puesto de venta   y  de esta manera brindar variedad de productos a sus clientes,  su razón para solicitar este préstamo es seguir mejorando en su  negocio,  la Sra. Mariela es una persona muy trabajadora se siente feliz por la oportunidad brindada ya que este préstamo le permitirá crecer en su negocio.
texts.en:
Las Unidas - 32 Communal Bank is made up of seven women and one man.

Mariela's the president of the bank.  She makes a living selling a variety of soft drinks in her sales stall that's located in a very busy market in the city of Cochabamba.

This loan is Mariela's second sequence with the institution.  She's going to use it to buy a variety of soft drinks wholesale to stock her stall and offer her customers a variety of products.  She's requesting this loan to keep on improving her business.

Mariela's a very hardworking person.  She's happy for this opportunity because this loan will help her grow in her business.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks wholesale

loans.name: Jiguisseme Group

texts.fr:
Les six  membres du groupe JIGUISSEME sont des femmes mariées ayant une moyenne d’âge de 40 ans, 4 enfants et vivant la plupart dans des familles monogamiques au quartier Lafiabougou de  Loulouni un des villages de Sikasso 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles sont à leur troisième prêt avec l’institution de micro finance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle. 
Mme  ANCHATA en première position de la gauche vers la droite fait le commerce de   condiments.
Elle compte acheter avec son  prêt environ 30 kg d’oignon 1 panier de poivre, du sel, du soumbala ainsi que du piment qu’elle revendra en détail au marché ainsi qu’à la maison à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes au comptant. 
Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 11 000 francs CFA dont une partie est  utilisée  pour payer le prêt et son interêt et l’autre pour son épargne.
texts.en:
The six members of the Jiguisseme group are married women with an average age of 40 years and 4 children each. They live mostly in monogamous families in the Lafiabougou neighborhood of Loulouni, one of the towns in Sikasso, the 3rd administrative region of Mali. They are on their third loan with the microfinance organization Soro Yirwaso, in order to meet the needs of their customers.

Anchata, pictured in first position from left to right, is in the spice business. She plans to use her loan to purchase around 30 kg of onions, 1 basket of pepper, salt, and some soumbala and seasonings that she will resell at retail for cash in the market as well as from her home to a customer base made up of both men and women. She hopes to earn an average monthly profit of 11,000 francs CFA, of which a portion will be used to pay off the loan and interest and the remainder will go to her savings.

loans.use: to purchase spices

loans.name: Brenda

texts.es:
Brenda  es una señorita soltera de  18 años de edad. Ella actualmente vive junto a sus padres en el Caserío Central, Aldea Los Encuentros, Sololá, Sololá.
Ella actualmente tiene una tortillería en una tienda de su padre. Eligió esta actividad ya que de esta manera puede aportar a la economía de su familia. Comenta que por las mañanas se dedica a la tortillería y por las tardes a estudiar, esto lo hace con el fin de superarse para ayudar a su familia.
Ahora lleva 5 años de realizar esta actividad que cada día existe más demanda, es por ello que está solicitando un préstamo de Q 5,000.00 para la compra de una estufa más grande ya que con la otra no se da abasto para la elaboración de sus tortillas.
Su meta es generar más ganancias a través de su negocio para poder seguir estudiando y graduarse en el nivel medio, para tener mejores oportunidades en la vida.
texts.en:
Brenda is a single young woman of 18 years. She currently lives with her parents in the Caserío Central, Aldea Los Encuentros, Sololá, Sololá.

She currently has a tortillería in her father's shop. She chose this activity because in this way she can contribute to her family's finances. In the morning she works at the tortillería, and she studies in the afternoon, which she does with the goal to better herself so she can help her family.

She has run this business for 5 years, and every day there is greater demand. It is because of this that she is asking for a loan of Q 5,000 to buy a larger stove, now that she cannot keep up tortilla preparation with the other. Her goal is to generate more earnings across the board so she may continue studying and graduate from school to obtain better opportunities in life.

loans.use: To buy a stove to prepare tortillas

loans.name: Dúo Crisastemo Group

texts.es: Dúo Crisastemo, este grupo esta conformado por la señora Rossemary de 37 años de edad, por muchos años ella se ha dedicado a la venta de granos bsicos(tienda)ella en esta ocacion esta solicitando la ayuda de Kiva ya que gracias a Dios sus clientes han aumentado, esta solicitando este credito para la compra de mercaderia de granos basicos esperando que por medio de ustedes ella pueda surtir un poco mas su tienda y seguir luchando para estar mejor con su familia.
texts.en:
The Dúo Crisastemo group is made up of Rossemary, who is 37 years old. For many years, she has made her living selling staple goods in a store. 

For this occasion, she is asking for the help of Kiva. Thanks to God, her customers have grown, and she is asking for this loan to buy merchandise, consisting of staple goods. She hopes that with your help she can supply her store a little more and continue striving to be better with her family.

loans.use: to buy staple goods to sell.

loans.name: Jenit

texts.es: Jenit tiene 41 años de edad, es madre soltera de un hijo con quien vive en su casa propia. Jenit se dedica a la venta de productos comestibles al por menor,  como  actividad complementaria se dedica a la agrocultura. Jenit  comienza  el  negocio de venta de productos comestibles por la necesidad de contar con este tipo de negocio en su localidad, gracia a su capacidad emprendedora comenzó con el negocio. Gracias a esta actividad mejoro la calidad de vida de su familia.Este es su primer crédito con Kiva y se siente agradecida por el apoyo financiero que recibe para seguir adelante, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual. Con el monto solicitado de S/.1500.00 comprará productos comestibles tales como arroz, azúcar, conservas de pescado, entre otros.
texts.en:
Jenit is a 41-year-old single mother that lives with her son in their own home. Jenit sells foodstuffs retail, and as a secondary job does agroculture. Jenit started to sell foodstuffs because of the need of this type of business in her neighborhood, thanks to her entrepreneurial capabilities. Thanks to this business she has improved the quality of life of her family.

This is her first loan with Kiva, and she feels grateful for the financial help she will receive to move forward, and further promises to pay her debts in a timely manner. With the requested loan of S/. 1500 she will buy foodstuffs such as rice, sugar, and canned fish, among others.

loans.use: To buy foodstuffs such as rice, sugar, canned fish, and others

loans.name: Mirador De Chumpe Group

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco MIRADOR DE CHUMPE, el banco está ubicado en la comunidad de Chumpe, distrito de Lamay  y provincia de Calca.
La socia Inocencia tiene 52 años de edad, casada y tiene 06 hijos, la socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de crianza de animales menores como cuyes, la socia lleva buen tiempo dedicándose a este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia cría a estos animalitos para luego venderlos a sus cliente que le solicitan, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa siendo de esta forma que la socia  saca adelante  a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de cuyes y alimentos para sus animalitos.
Al momento de tomar la foto el socio Carlos se agacho para firmar algunos documentos.

Los demás socios se dedican a la venta de artesania, crianza de animales menores, venta de ovinos y albañiles.
La socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
Inocencia is a member of the"MIRADOR DE CHUMPE" communal bank, which is located in Chumpe, Lamay district, Calca province. Inocencia is 52 years old, married and has six children. She alternates between her daily activities and raising small animals like guinea pigs. She has done this business for a long time now and it is going well for her thanks to the effort she makes daily. She raises the animals and sells them to customers who ask her for them. Inocencia is a responsible and persevering person. This is how she gets her family ahead. 

 Inocencia is asking for this loan to buy guniea pigs and feed for them. She is grateful for the loan granted to the group and she promises to pay her installments on time.

The other members of the communal bank sell handicrafts, raise small animals, sell sheep and bricklay. When the photo was taken the member Carlos was bending over as he had some documents to sign.

loans.use: to buy guinea pigs and feed for them.

loans.name: Zavur

texts.en: Zavur is an IDP (internally displaced person) from the Fuzuli city. Now he lives in the Fuzuli region with his family. Zavur is married and has two daughters. He started a business raising sheep two years ago. Now he needs a loan of 1,800 AZN (Azerbaijan New manat) to expand his farm. He wants to use the money for his family's future. In the future, Zavur wants to have more sheep and goats, which will be more profitable for his business. Zavur is thankful to Komak and Kiva for supporting him again. It is his second loan on Kiva.

loans.use: to expand his farm

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy is 48 years old and married to Austine. They have seven children, three of whom are in school.

She is in the business of selling clothes in Ndunyu Njeru. She has operated this business for seven years and has applied for her first loan from KADET to enable her to buy clothes for resale. With her anticipated profit, she plans to pay for school fees and also rent a house where she will establish her business. 

In the near future, Lucy hopes to expand her business and improve her family's living standards.

loans.use: To buy clothes to resell.

loans.name: Prudence

texts.en: This marks Prudence's fifth loan from KADET Ltd, after repaying her previous loans successfully. She will use the requested loan to expand her current business by purchasing more cloth material and shoes to sell, which is especially needed because this is the season that schools reopen after a short break. She will use the anticipated profit to repay her loan and educate her children. In the future, she hopes to own a wholesale shop.

loans.use: to purchase more materials and shoes to sell.

loans.name: Feiruz

texts.en:
This marks Feiruz's second borrowing from KADET Ltd., after servicing her loan successfully. She will use the loan to purchase bales of assorted shoes for her stock. Her clientele has grown immensely, and she is doing great.
 
She will use the proceeds to service her loan and open a retail shop for her shoes, and she hopes to become an international business lady in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more shoes for resale.

loans.name: Kour

texts.en:
Kour is 50 years old and lives in Montserrado County, which is the number-one commercial county in Liberia since it has the capital city of Liberia.  

She is a widow and has no children. For the past 12 years, she has been operating a cook shop selling fufu (dough made of cassava), rice and soup.  Kour started this business with assistance from her friends and learned this way of selling from them. She enjoys her business because it helps her to save enough money for expenses. 

She is requesting a loan to purchase more inventory like cassava, rice, peppers, oil, meat, fish, etc., for her business. In the near future, she wants to expand her business even more.

loans.use: to purchase more inventory like cassava, rice, peppers, oil, meat, fish, etc., for her business.

loans.name: Jackline

texts.en: This marks Jackline's fifth borrowing to finance her business and expand her business premises. Her business has been a success, and she has been able to service her loan well. She will use the anticipated profit and proceeds to pay her daughter's college fee and repay her loan. She hopes her business will remain sustainable and continue to grow big in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more sugar, rice, cooking oil and tea leaves.

loans.name: Hannah

texts.en:
