Veronicah is 43 years old and comes from Olkalou. She is not married but she has two children aged 16 and 10 years who are in school.

She is a farmer and she has been in this sector for the past five years. She has applied for a loan of Kshs. 60,000 from Kadet Ltd, her fourth loan, and her intention is to use it in buying a heifer and some herbicides to control weeds in her farm for increased yields.

Her monthly income right now is Ksh. 10,000 and her plan is to use the anticipated profits from her expanded business for repaying her loan and to also pay school fees for her children. Her hopes and dreams are that in future she will have a better, improved life than she has now.

loans.use: To buy a heifer and some herbicides for increased productivity

loans.name: Elisabeth

texts.en:
Elisabeth is a woman of thirty six years, married to James, and a mother of five children. She sells fish in Kangemi and has been in this business for eighteen years. She gets a monthly income of 25,000 KES.

This will be Elisabeth's second loan with KADET LTD. She plans to use the entire loan to buy different types of fish. In the future, she wants to expand her business and educate her children.

loans.use: to buy different types of fish.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is a married woman. She has two children, ages 9 years and 14 years. She describes herself to be motivated and helpful. She operates a green grocery where she sells vegetables and fruits. She has been involved in this business for three years. Her business is located in a strategic place. 

Virginia describes her biggest business challenge to be price fluctuations of products. She will use the KES 30,000 loan to add stock of pineapples, watermelons and other fruits and vegetables . This is her second loan with SMEP DTM. Her previous loan of KES 70,000 was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to add stock of pineapples, watermelons and other vegetables

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy is a 33-year-old married woman. She has 4 children with ages ranging from 2 to 11 years. She describes herself to be self-driven and trustworthy. 

She operates a poultry farm where she keeps broilers for sale; she has been involved in this business for 7 years. Her business is located in an easily accessible location which is conducive for business with her primary customers, common citizens. She describes her biggest business challenge to be a lack of adequate funds. 

She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy chicken feed and more poultry. Her business goal is to be a large scale provider of poultry products within 5 years. She hopes that, in the future, she will diversify her business and generate great profits. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: buy chicken feed and more poultry

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith is a married woman who has 2 children who are 2 and 5 years old. She describes herself to be focused and intelligent. 

Judith operates a retail shop where she sells sugar, salt, wheat flour and other household items. She has been involved in this business for 5 years. Her business is located in a very viable location and her primary customers are of all types. She will use the KES 70,000 loan to purchase additional stock of sugar, salt, wheat flour, cooking oil and other items. Her business goal is to have a very viable business with various businesses within 5 years. 

This is her third loan with SMEP DTM; her previous loan of KES 50,000 was repaid successfully.

loans.use: purchase additional stock of sugar, salt, wheat flour, cooking oil and other items

loans.name: Harison

texts.en:
Harison is a 36-year-old married man. He has 5 children with ages ranging from 4 to 14 years. He describes himself as being dependable.

Harison operates a clothing store where he makes clothes and sells them. He has been involved in this business for 7 years. His business is located in a suburban area and his primary customers are small scale buyers. He describes his biggest business challenge as insufficient savings. 

He will use the KES 20,000 loan to add to his stock of clothes for resale. His business goal is to be financially stable within 5 years. This is his third loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: make additional clothing stock for resale

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy is a 52-year-old woman. She has five children. She describes herself to be a good decision maker. She operates a farm where she keeps pigs, cows and also does farming. She has been involved in this business for 12 years. Her business is located in a favorable area and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of enough funds. 

Lucy will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy animal feed and pesticides. Her business goal is to have a well-established milk business within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will have established several sales branches. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: buy animal feed and pesticides

loans.name: Alice

texts.en: Alice is a 52-year-old woman. She has six children with ages ranging from 20 years to 30 years. She describes herself to be a self-starter. She operates a farm where she keeps pigs, cows and also does farming. She has been involved in this business for five years. Her business is located in a favorable area and her primary customers are restaurants. She describes her biggest business challenge to be weather changes. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy animal feed and other items. She hopes that in the future, she will be the a leading milk supplier in the area she lives. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy animal feed and other items

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth is a 39-year-old married woman. She has three children. She describes herself to be determined. She operates a farm where she keeps pigs, cows, poultry and also does farming. She has been involved in this business for 10 years. Her business is located in a favorable area and her primary customers are local residents. 

Ruth describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of enough funds. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy animal feed and other items to boost business. Her business goal is to be a regional supplier of animal feed within five years. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy animal feed and other items to boost business

loans.name: Tabitha

texts.en: Tabitha is a 42-year-old married woman. She has three children with ages ranging from 12 years to 23 years. She describes herself to be reliable. She operates a farm where she has dairy cows. She has been involved in this business for six years. Her business is located in a favorable place. She describes her biggest business challenge to be unfavorable prices. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more cows. Her business goal is to grow her business within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will have a greenhouse. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy more cows

loans.name: Jacob

texts.en:
Jacob is a 30-year-old married man. He has two children, ages 1 year and 5 years old. Jacob describes himself as determined. He operates a farm where he keeps dairy cows and chicken. He has been involved in this business for five years. His business is located in an area that is good for business and his primary customers are local residents. Jacob describes his biggest business challenge as a lack of enough funds to boost business. 

Jacob will use this KES 20,000 loan to buy animal feed and other items to boost business. His business goal is to be the regional supplier of farm products within five years. This is his first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: buy animal feed and other items to boost business

loans.name: Samson

texts.en:
Samson is 34 years old and from Ndunyu Njeru. He is married to Lucy and they have three children who are in school.

Samson has been in the farming business for seven years and has applied for his second loan from Kadet Ltd after repaying his previous loan on time. He intends to use this loan to buy a motorbike. With the anticipated profits, Samson plans to buy seeds, fertilizer, and a cow.

Samson hopes to grow his farming business and earn more income to improve the living standards of his family

loans.use: To buy a motorbike.

loans.name: Gloria Ramona

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Chimborazo se reúne cada quince días en la parroquia Picoaza de la ciudad de Portoviejo. Lugar conocido por ser una zona muy comercial, por sus fiestas tradicionales de San Pedro y San Pablo y por la alegría de su gente.

En este lugar vive la señora Gloria, tiene 37 años de edad, mantiene una relación de unión libre y de esta relación tiene tres hijos de 15, 13 y 10 años, los mayores  estudian en colegio y la menor en escuela. El marido es comerciante.

Doña Gloria se dedica al comercio, vende ropa de todo tipo y productos naturales de Garden,  su forma de  venta es puerta a puerta y también vende en su  casa donde tiene un pequeño local,  la mayor parte de su mercadería vende bajo pedidos que le realizan sus clientes con anticipación. Trabaja tres  días a la semana en las mañanas ya que a esa hora tiene que llegar  a su casa a preparar la comida  para cuando lleguen sus hijos de la escuela y en las tardes a veces cuando tiene tiempo también se va  a  hacer sus ventas, deja sus productos a crédito y cobra cada domingo. Son 8 años que se dedica a esta actividad con la cual se gana algo por el bienestar de sus hijos.

Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar más mercadería como: pantalones, blusas, camisetas y ropa de niños. Está en el banco comunal desde sus inicios y le gusta por la ayuda que recibe con estos créditos. 

Su sueño es seguir adelante en su negocio.
texts.en:
The Chimborazo communal bank meets every 2 weeks in the Picoaza parish within the city of Portoviejo.  This area is known for it's shopping, traditional San Pedro and San Pablo parties, and for the happiness of its residents.

This is where Gloria lives.  She is 37 years old and is in a free union in which she has three children (15, 13, and 10 years old).  Her older two children are in high school and her young daughter is in primary school.  Her husband works in sales.

Gloria works selling all kinds of clothes and Garden natural products.  She sells door to door and also sells in her house, where she has a small shop set up.  Most of her business comes from orders that her customers place ahead of time.  She works 3 days a week during the morning hours, since afterwards she has to go home to fix her children food for when they get home from school.  In the afternoon, she sometimes has time to go and sell.  She makes her sales on credit and collects payments every Sunday.  She has had this business for 8  years and has been able to help support her children.

She will use this loan to buy additional merchandise such as pants, blouses, t-shirts, and children's clothes.  She has been with this communal bank since it got started and she likes it because of the help she gets in the form of these loans.

She goal is to progress with her business.

loans.use: buy pants, blouses, t-shirts, and children's clothes.

loans.name: Esperanza Marlene

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Chimborazo se reúne cada quince días en la parroquia Picoaza de la ciudad de Portoviejo. Lugar conocido por ser una zona muy comercial, por sus fiestas tradicionales de San Pedro y San Pablo y por la alegría de su gente.
Aquí vive la señora Esperanza, tiene 44 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene cuatro hijos, dos mayores y dos de 17 y 14 años que estudian en colegio, tres de ellos aun viven en su casa. Su esposo es comerciante informal.

Doña Esperanza es una gran esposa que realiza el crédito para su marido el cual se dedica a la venta de ropa interior y productos de plástico, su marido se desplaza a otras ciudades a ofrecer sus productos, trabaja cuatro días a la semana en especial los fines de semana que es cuando más ventas realiza y mejores ganancias le quedan, el trabajo del marido es cansado pero a la vez es la única forma que él tiene para ganarse la vida y el sustento de toda su familia, lleva más de 15 años dedicado a esta actividad la cual les permite salir adelante.

Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar ropa interior y productos de plástico. Es socia fundadora del Banco comunal y le gusta por las facilidades para conseguir los créditos.

Su sueño es tener un carro para que su marido realice sus ventas.
texts.en:
The Chimborazo communal bank meets every fortnight in the Picoaza Parish in the city of Portoviejo. The city is known for it's commerce, it's traditional festivals of San Pedro and San Pablo and for the joy of it's people. 

Esperanza lives here. She is 44 years old, married with four children from this relationship. Two are adults and two, aged 7 and 1, study in Secondary School. Three of them still live at home.  Her husband is an informal merchant. Esperanza is a great wife, who is taking out this loan for her husband who sells underwear and plastic products. He goes to other cities to offer his products for sale. He works four days a a week, especially on weekends when sales are the best. This work is tiring but at the same time it is the only way he has of making a living and providing for the family. He has been doing this for 15 years which allows his family to carry on. This loan will be used to buy underwear and plastic goods.

Esperanza is a founding member of the communal bank and she likes it as she can use it to obtain loans. Her dream is to buy a cart for her husband to sell from.

loans.use: to buy underwear and plastic products.

loans.name: Garnik

texts.en:
Garnik lives in Sevan city. He is married and has two daughters. His wife works at the local school as a teacher of mathematics. Both his daughters have higher education and now the elder one is employed. 

Garnik has graduated Yerevan State Economical Institute and has a specialty as an economist. For several years, he has worked as an inspector, and now he works at the territorial Inventory subdivision as a service office manager. 

In the near future, Garnik’s elder daughter is going to get married. Her parents are very pleased and happy for their daughter since the young man who is going to be her husband is very clever, educated, and prosperous person.
 
Garnik asks for a loan of 1,000,000 Armenian drams in order to organize his daughter’s wedding party properly and as nice as she wishes.

loans.use: to organize his daughter’s wedding party properly and as nice as she wishes.

loans.name: Ingris

texts.es: Ingris está muy agradecida por el crédito otorgado anteriormente  y por haber creído en ella. Ahora se siente muy contenta porque su negocio está más surtido con lo que compró: gafas, Compact Disc y gorras en un mayor volumen, lo que llama la atención de los clientes en su sector y en los alrededores. Ella muy  motivada,  planea continuar manteniéndolo, para más adelante ampliarlo. Su credikiva lo ha beneficiado porque al aumentar sus inventarios, vende más y sus ingresos se incrementan. En la actualidad está aplicando a un nuevo crédito, mediante el cual comprará  ropa infantil, camisetas deportivas para surtir su negocio.
texts.en:
Ingris is very grateful for the loan granted to her previously and for having believed in her. 

Now she is very happy because her business is more stocked with what she purchased: glasses, CDs and caps in higher volume, which draws her customers' attention in her area as well as surrounding areas. She is very motivated and plans to continuously maintain it; expanding it in the future. 

Her loan with Kiva has benefitted her by increasing her inventory. She sells more and her income has increased. 

At the present time she's applying for a new loan to buy children’s wear, sports t-shirts to stock her business.

loans.use: to buy children’s wear, sports t-shirts to stock her business.

loans.name: Lovette

texts.en: Lovette is 21 years old; she is single and lives at home in Montserrado County which is noted as the commercial city in Liberia. She is a seventh grade dropout. For five years now she  has been involved in the sales of fashion clothes such as blouses, T-shirts, and dresses; most interestingly, she has many customers since she sells quality  products. She started her business selling for her mother,and learned this way of selling from her friends, too. She spends 8 hours each day on her business. One of the problems she faces is transportation costs. She is requesting a loan to purchase more fashion clothes (blouses, T-shirts, and dresses) to increase her sales. Her plan is to build a store.

loans.use: to purchase more fashion clothes (blouses, T-shirts, and dresses) to increase her sales,

loans.name: Moisés Salomón

texts.es:
Moisés es un joven que estudio hasta 6º grado, ya que sus padres son de escasos recursos económicos y decidió dejar de estudiar y empezar a trabajar, como ayudante de albañilería y ayudarles a sus padres con los gastos de la casa. Esta casado, su esposa cuida de sus dos  hijos de dos años y otro de 11 meses.

Él trabaja en una peluquería, oficio que aprendió desde los 11 años de edad, también conoce un poco de los trabajos de albañilería y carpintería. El lugar en el cual trabaja, esta a una distancia de 10 km de su casa, sale  a las 6.30 de la mañana de su casa, aborda el autobús, el cual lo deja a una cuadra de su trabajo. Su horario es de 7.30 a.m. a 5 p.m.

El préstamo que esta solicitando, es para comprar las medicinas para uno de sus hijos, el cual esta enfermo y necesita de un tratamiento medico.

El sueño de Moisés, es tener su propio negocio de peluquería. Brindarles la oportunidad de estudiar a sus hijos, y que se superen lo mas que puedan, para que sean personas honradas y responsables, y no sufran los problemas que él tubo que enfrentar.
texts.en:
Moisés is a young man who studied through the sixth grade.  His parents had limited resources, so he decided to quit school and start working.  He got a job as a masonry assistant and was able to help his parents with the household expenses.  Moisés is married and his wife takes care of their two children, ages 2 and 11 months.  

Moisés works at a barber shop since he has been learning the trade since he was 11 years old.  In addition, he knows a little bit about masonry and carpentry.  The place where he works is located 10 kilometers from his house.  He leaves his house at 6:30 A.M., boards a bus, and walks a block to his job.  His schedule is from 7:30 A.M. to 5:00 P.M.

The loan he is requesting will be used to buy medicines for one of his children who is sick and needs this treatment.  Moisés dreams of having his own barber shop and providing an education for his children so that they can accomplish more than he did.  He wants them to be honest and responsible people and not have to suffer the problems that he encountered.

loans.use: to buy medicines for one of his children.

loans.name: Jovica

texts.en:
Jovica is 50 years old, married, and a father of a 19-year-old daughter. He, his wife, and daughter live in a minority community in Kosovo. 

Jovica is a very hard-working man, but his situation has changed dramatically after the war, leaving him without a job. He is lucky that now he receives a pension from the electrical company that he used to work for, together with his wife, before the war, but it is not enough to provide his family with enough and adequate income. He has tried all possible ways to survive and provide himself with a stable income, but has not had much success.

For the first time, Jovica is now requesting a loan to pay for materials needed for his kitchen. His goal is to find a job since he hopes to have more income in the future. He appreciates this help!

loans.use: to pay for materials needed for his kitchen.

loans.name: Milly

texts.en:
Milly is 18 years old and lives in the town of Nakifuma in the Mukono region of Uganda. She has no children. For the past three years, Milly has been working hard to manage her boutique shop. 

To help expand her business, Milly has requested a loan of 700,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more clothes to sell, which will help Milly generate greater profits and take care of herself and be independent. Milly hopes that in the future she will be able to expand the the shop into a big boutique.

Milly is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes to resell

loans.name: Tomas

texts.es:
Tomas vive con su hijo en la zona de Alto San Pedro de la ciudad de La Paz. El oficio que desempeña es el de transportista en el sector público, además de vender cerveza. Tomas necesita el crédito para  la compra de una acción o permiso para prestar sus servicios como chofer (en Bolivia, cualquiera que quiera dedicarse al transporte público debe pertenecer a un sindicato y comprar una acción del mismo para poder trabajar, lo cual esta permitido por el gobierno boliviano) y así poder obtener mayores beneficios y poder cubrir con los gastos que tiene en su hogar.

El sueño de Tomas es poder acceder a la compra de un casa propia tener los ingresos económicos suficientes para poder brindar a su hijo la calidad de vida a la cual el no pudo acceder.
texts.en:
Tomas lives with his son in the Alto San Pedro area of the city of La Paz. The trade he is involved in is as a driver in the public sector, as well as a beer vendor.

Tomas needs the loan to buy a share or permit to provide his services as a driver. (In Bolivia, anyone who wishes to work in public transit must belong to a union and purchase a share of it to work, which is permitted by the Bolivian government.) 

In this way, he will be able to earn greater benefits and be able to cover his household expenses.

Tomas' dream is to be able to buy his own home and to have sufficient income to be able to bring his son a quality of life which he could not access.

loans.use: to pay for his permit to work as a driver.

loans.name: Reyna

texts.es:
Reyna es comerciante, se dedica a la venta de hoja de  coca en las poblaciones alejadas de la ciudad, vive en la casa de sus padres, donde ella construyo un pequeño departamento en la zona de Villa el Carmen de la ciudad de la Paz.
El crédito lo  requiere para el aumento de su capital, y de esta manera poder llegar a más poblaciones adquiriendo más mercadería, e incrementar sus ingresos. La venta de coca para mates es un negocio legitimo y rentable 

El sueño de Reyna es poder apoyar a sus hijos con educación para que estos puedan ser profesionales y tener acceso a un mejor nivel de vida.
texts.en:
Reyna’s a merchant; she sells coca leaf in population centers far from the city.  She lives in her parents’ house in small apartment she built; it’s in the city of La Paz’s Villa del Carmen zone.

She needs the loan to increase her capital so that she can reach more population centers to buy more merchandise and increase her income.  The sale of coca leaf to make tea is a legitimate, profitable business.

Reyna’s dream is to support her children’s schooling so that they may become professionals and be able to access a better standard of living.

loans.use: to buy coca leaf.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.es: Lucy, de 41 años, es madre  soltera.  Vive en su casa propia junto a su hijo de 03 años y su sobrina. Lucy se dedica a la venta de productos de cosméticos por catalogo tales como delineadores, cremas, perfumes, ropa electrodomésticos, entre otros, este trabajo lo realiza desde su vivienda en donde instalo un pequeño local en el cual exhibe sus diferentes productos. También sale a las calles a ofrecer y repartir su mercadería entre sus amigos, vecinos y familiares, lleva con este trabajo más de 03 años, esta actividad económica la realiza sola. Se inicio en esta labor ya que no tenia el apoyo económico para la crianza de  su hijo por ello decidió salir adelante poniendo su propio negocio. Este es su cuarto préstamo con Kiva,y se siente agradecida por el apoyo financiero que recibe para seguir adelante. Con el monto solicitado de S/.3000 soles, comprara más productos como perfumes, cremas corporales, ropa, entre otros.
texts.en:
Lucy, 41, is a single mother living in her own house with her 3-year-old son and her niece.  Lucy works selling cosmetics like eyeliner, cream, perfume, clothes, home appliances, etc. via catalog.  She works from home where she set up a small locale to display her various goods.  She also heads out into the streets to sell and distribute merchandise among her friends, neighbors and family members.  She’s been doing this work for more than 3 years and works alone.  She started this work because she had no economic support for her son so she decided to get ahead by opening her own business.

This is her 4th Kiva loan and she feels grateful for the financial support she gets to continue moving forward.  She will use the requested 3,000 soles to buy products like perfume, body cream and clothes, among others.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics.

loans.name: Luz

texts.es:
Luz es comerciante, vende todo tipo de productos medicinales naturales en poblaciones distantes a la ciudad, vive en casa propia, en la zona de Villa el Carmen de la ciudad de la Paz.
El crédito lo  requiere incrementar capitl de trabajoy de esta manera poder aumentar sus ingresos al comprar más medicinas naturales para su negocio.

El sueño de Luz es poder tener siempre lo necesario para vivir bien sin problemas de dinero y salud además de apoyar con la educación a sus hijos hasta que estos puedan valerse por si mismos teniendo de esta manera un mejor nivel de vida.
texts.en:
Luz is a salesperson. She sells all types of natural medicine products to people living outside the city. She lives in her own house, in the Villa el Carmen zone of the city of Paz.

She needs the loan to increase her working capital and, in this way, to be able to increase her profits to buy more natural medicine for her business.

Luz’s dream is to be able to always have what she needs to live well without money and health problems. Additionally, her dream is to support the education of her children until they make use of it themselves and, in this way, have a better level of living.

loans.use: to increase her working capital for her natural medicines business.

loans.name: Abdoulaye

texts.fr:
Monsieur ABDOULAYE né en 1980, marié et père 3 enfants, il vit dans une famille nucléaire au quartier Banankabougou de la ville de Fana. 
Monsieur ABDOULAYE fait des activités d’achat et de vente d’articles divers depuis maintenant  plus de six ans, dans une boutique.
La demande de ses clients  augmente actuellement expliquant un écoulement rapide de ses marchandises.
Il est à son troisième prêt et tous les 2 précédents ont été bien remboursés souvent même par anticipation.  
Avec ce nouveau prêt, il compte acheter cinq petits et quatre gros cartons de biscuits, 10 bidons d’huile, trois cartons de spaghetti, 50 cartes de recharges Orange Mali, 30 cartes de recharges Malitel, un carton de 30 torches à pile, un carton de thé, une trentaine de sachet de lait en poudre avec les grossistes de Bamako. Ces marchandises seront vendues dans la boutique à Fana. La clientèle est composée de femmes et d’hommes.  
Il compte réaliser un bénéfice de 60 000F CFA par  mois  qu’il utilisera pour les dépenses de la famille et le reste dans son activité de vente de boutique
texts.en:
Mr Abdoulaye was born in 1980, is married and is the father of three children. He lives in a nuclear family in the neighborhood called Banankabougou in the town of Fana. 
 
Mr Abdoulaye has been buying and selling various items for more than six years now, in a small shop. The demand among his customers has recently grown, causing rapid sales of his merchandise. He is on his third loan and the two preceding ones were correctly reimbursed, indeed often in advance of the due date. 

With this new loan, he intends to buy five small cartons and one large carton of biscuits, 10 jerrycans of oil, three cartons of spaghetti, 50 rechargeable phone cards for Orange Mali, 30 rechargeable cards for Malitel, one carton of 30 battery-operated flashlights, a carton of tea, and around thirty envelopes of powdered milk from the wholesalers in Bamako. This merchandise will be sold in the shop in Fana. His clientele is composed of women and men. 

He expects to make a profit of 60,000 f CFA per month that he will use for family expenses, investing any remainder in his little shop.

loans.use: to buy various items for his shop

loans.name: Odiouma

texts.fr:
Monsieur  ODIOUMA  est âgé de 25 ans et vit avec ses quatre enfants et son épouse dans une famille nucléaire à N’TENTOU, un des quartiers de la sous préfecture Ouelessebougou, Région de Koulikoro.
ODIOUMA n’a pas eu la chance  d’aller à l’école. Très tôt  il s’intéressa aux activités génératrices de revenus notamment à l’achat vente des articles de boutique et autres articles divers. Il a appris cette activité auprès de son oncle maternel, qui  fut jadis un grand commerçant d’articles divers. 
Dans le souci de satisfaire sa clientèle en nette croissance, il décida de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso. Il est à son quatrième prêt individuel  qui servira à acheter, 2 tonnes de riz, 5 sacs de sucre et 2 cartons de thé auprès des grossistes de BAMAKO qu’il revend en détail à OUELESSEBOUGOU à crédit et au comptant à une clientèle mixte.
ODIOUMA espère réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 100.000. FCFA qui sera utilisé pour rembourser le prêt et  être réinvestir le reste dans les activités.
texts.en:
Mr. Odiouma is 25 years old and lives with his four children and his wife in a nuclear family in N'tentou, one of the neighborhoods of Ouelessebougou in the Koulikoro region.
Odiouma did not have the good luck to go to school. Very early in his life he became interested in money making activities especially buying and selling of store goods and various other articles. He learned this business from his maternal uncle who used to be a great storekeeper of various products.
Aiming to satisfy his rapidly growing clientele, he decided to collaborate with Soro Yiriwaso. This is his fourth individual loan which will enable him to buy 2 tons of rice, 5 bags of sugar and 2 boxes of tea from the wholesalers in Bamako, which he will sell retail in Ouelessebougou for cash and for credit to a mixed clientele.
Odiouma hopes to make an average monthly profit of 100.000. FCFA which he will use to repay his loan and reinvest in his business.

loans.use: To buy various articles.

loans.name: Irene

texts.es:
La socia sigue dedicándose a su negocio de restaurante ,la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa ,la socia prepara desayunos, almuerzo y cenas para sus clientes que le solicitan, la socia prepara diversos platos como arroz con pollo, estofados, sopas entre otros, cada día varia la comida para sus clientes, la socia lleva años con su negocio el cual le trae satisfacciones tanto económicas como personales, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma pueda seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de insumos como arroz ,aceite y otros. 
La socia se compromete a hacer sus pagos en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
This client continues working in the restaurant business.  She’s a responsible, hardworking person.  

She makes breakfasts, lunches and dinners for her customers that request them.  She prepares various dishes like rice and chicken, stews and soups, among others.  She varies her meals daily for her customers.   

She’s been in business for years and it provides both economic and personal satisfaction.   She’d like to be able to continue working in order to be able to continue supporting her family.

She needs the loan to buy supplies like rice, oil and others.  She commits to make her payments as scheduled.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like rice, oil and others.

loans.name: Japheth

texts.en:
Japheth is a married man. He has 6 children. He describes himself to be honest. He operates a restaurant where he sells food. He has been involved in this business for three years. His business is located in a busy area and his primary customers are of all types. 

He describes his biggest business challenge to be lack of funds. He will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more tables for customers to use in the restaurant. His business goal is to have a chain of restaurants within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will support his family. This is his first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy more tables for customers to use in the restaurant.

loans.name: Michael

texts.en:
Michael is 43 years old and comes from Nakuru. He is married to Agatha who does not produce additional income for the family. He has four children aged 14, 11, 8 and 3 years old.

He has a general retail shop where he sells vegetables like tomatoes, cabbages and onions and he also sells items like sugar, flour, salt, cooking fat, rice, etc. He has applied for a loan of  Kshs. 20,000 which is his second from Kadet Ltd, and he intends to use it for adding stock to his shop.

His monthly income at present is Kshs. 15,000 and his intention is to use the anticipated profit from the expanded business for improving his farming activities. His hopes and dreams for the future are that one day he will buy some plots and build rental houses for more income.

loans.use: To buy more stock like vegetables (tomatoes and cabbages) and groceries

loans.name: Anastacia

texts.en: Anastacia is a 43-year-old married woman. She has 8 children. She describes herself to be optimistic. She operates a retail store where she sells sugar, soap and other consumer goods. She has been involved in this business for 4 years. Her business is located in a busy area and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be high prices from suppliers. She will use the loan of 20,000 KES to purchase additional stock of salt, sugar and other consumer products. Her business goal is to meet her family's needs within 5 years. She hopes that in the future she will improve their living standards. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock of salt, sugar and other consumer products.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy is a 27-year-old married woman. She has two children, ages 4 and 7 years old. Nancy describes herself as innovative. She operates a farm where she keeps dairy cows and also does farming. She has been involved in this business for three years. Her business is located in an area that is good for business and her primary customers are hotels. Nancy describes her biggest business challenge as pests that attack crops. 

Nancy will use this KES 20,000 loan to buy animal feed and fertilizer. Her business goal is to start her own company to sell farm products within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will establish a greenhouse to grow horticultural crops. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy animal feed and fertilizer

loans.name: Jecinta

texts.en:
Jecinta is 51 years old from Olkalou. She is married to Mbuthi, who is a farmer, and they have six children, ages 31, 28, 26, 24, 22 and 19 years old.

Jecinta is a farmer who practices mixed farming and she has been in to this business for the past six years. She has applied for her second loan of KES 20,000 from Kadet Ltd which will enable her to buy farm inputs like planting seeds, fertilizer, and a heifer in order to boost her productivity. 

Jecinta's monthly income at present is KES 15,000 and she hopes to use the anticipated profits from her expanded business to repay her loan and to cater to the needs of her family. Her hope and dream for her future business and family is that she will be the major supplier of farm output in her area.

loans.use: To buy farm inputs like fertilizer, planting seeds, and a heifer.

loans.name: Gladwell

texts.en:
Gladwell is a 35-year-old married woman. She has two children, ages 9 and 11 years old. Gladwell describes herself as a risk taker. She operates a farm where she keeps dairy cows. She has been involved in this business for seven years. Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge as a lack of sufficient funds. 

Gladwell will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy animal feed. Her business goal is to be fully established within five years. She hopes that in the future she will be a supplier of milk and eggs. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy animal feed

loans.name: Henry

texts.en:
Henry is a 43-year-old married man. He has three children with ages ranging from 5 years to 13 years. Henry operates a farm where he keeps dairy cows. He has been involved in this business for 13 years. His business is located in an area with potential and his primary customers are retail customers. He describes his biggest business challenge as animal diseases. 

Henry will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy animal feed. His business goal is to increase milk production within five years. He will use the anticipated profits to construct better housing for his dairy cows.

loans.use: to buy animal feed

loans.name: Monica

texts.en:
Monica is a 27-year-old married woman. She has five children with ages ranging from 1 year to 10 years. Monica describes herself as honest. She operates a grocery store where she sells tomatoes, avocados, and fish. She has been involved in this business for two years. Her business is located in a busy area and her primary customers are the general public. She describes her biggest business challenge as inadequate capital. 

Monica will use the KES 30,000 loan to buy stock of tomatoes and other items for resale. Her business goal is to be prosperous within five years. This is her second loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy stock of tomatoes and other items for resale

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel is a married man. He has seven children. He describes himself to be passionate. 

Samuel operates a welding shop where he makes metal doors and windows. He has been involved in this business for two years. His business is located in a good area and his primary customers are house constructors. He describes his biggest business challenge to be the lack of sufficient construction materials. 

He will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy welding materials and also to pay school fees. This is his first loan with SMEP Deposit Taking Microfinance (SMEP DTM).

loans.use: to buy welding materials and also to pay school fees.

loans.name: Daniel Yankarlo

texts.es:
Daniel es un hombre de 31 años, es soltero, vive en la ciudad de Chincha con sus padres, el es muy trabajador, entusiasta, que dedica todos sus esfuerzos por salir adelante. 
Por iniciativa propia, Daniel trabaja pintando cuadros de arte,adicionalmente dicta clases de pintura en una escuela comunal de su ciudad, el trabaja todos los días por un aproximado de 10 horas y cree que le va bien por su dedicación y esfuerzo.
Daniel se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada comprara una computadora nuevo para retomar sus clases de diseño gráfico, así pues el seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de tener un taller de bellas y exhibir sus obras en grandes galerías.
texts.en:
Daniel’s a single, 31-year-old man living with his parents in the city of Chincha.  He’s very hardworking, enthusiastic and focuses all his efforts into getting ahead.

On his own initiative, Daniel works painting art pictures and also teaches painting classes in a communal school in his city.  He works every day for about 10 hours and believes he does well because of his dedication and effort.

Daniel is very grateful to Kiva lenders because thanks to the support provided he will buy a new computer to restart his graphic design classes thus continuing to work and strive to reach his great dream of owning a fine arts workshop and to exhibit his works in large galleries.

loans.use: to buy a computer.

loans.name: Mwanajuma

texts.en:
Mwanajuma is a married woman with six children. Only two are in school; the rest are grown-ups. She lives in her own house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

She makes juice from fruits and sells treated water from home to her neighbors and passersby.

With the loan of KES 50,000, she wants to purchase juice ingredients, such as fruits and sugar, and also gallons of water for resale. She joined Yehu to get financial support.

loans.use: to purchase juice ingredients, such as fruits and sugar, and also gallons of water for resale.

loans.name: Haleema

texts.en:
Haleema, a 53-year-old married woman, has successfully built her small restaurant with her husband, who is also shown in the photo. They have six years of experience in running their enterprise and have become famous in their town for proving the best quality of service. 


With a good repayment history Haleema, who previously took a loan to purchase furniture and utensils, is now requesting her sixth one for Rs, 45,000 to purchase a stock of rice and grains along with packs of oils, salt and spices. These purchases will enable them to cater to more customers. 

  
Haleema is hopeful that she can increase her income and improve her family's standard of living by providing quality food at a reasonable cost.

loans.use: to purchase a stock of rice and grains along with  packs of oils, salt and spices.

loans.name: Adán

texts.es: Adán de 55 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa y uno de sus tres hijos, desde hace años Adán es productor de café ya que su padre fue productor y fue quien le enseño todo lo relacionado a la producción de café. Adán a trabajado las tierras que su padre le heredo y ahora tiene una parte de su terreno la cual se gustaría reforestar por tal motivo pide un crédito para la compra de plantas las cuales sembrara en la parte de su terreno que falta reforestar y también quiere comprar fertilizantes que le ayudaran aumentar su producción y a las plantas nuevas las ayudara a crecer para así  en unos dos años tener una mejor cosecha y con ello obtener mayores ganancias económicas las cuales se verán reflejadas en una mejor calidad de vida para el y su familia y así  en un plazo poder cumplir su sueño que es el de comprar mas terreno para seguir con la siembra de café y tener una herencia que dejarle a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Adán is 55 years old and lives in his own home with his wife and one of their three children.  He has been a coffee producer for many years since his father was a producer and was the one who taught him everything about growing coffee.  Adán works the land that he inherited from his father.  At the moment, he would like to repopulate part of his land, so he is requesting a loan to buy coffee plants that he can sow on the land that needs to be replanted.  He also wants to buy fertilizers to increase production and help the new plants grow within the next two years.  This will result in a better harvest and increased profits, which will be reflected in a better quality of life for his family.  

Adán would like to fulfill his dream of buying more land so that he can continue to plant coffee and have an inheritance that he can leave to his children.

loans.use: to buy coffee plants and fertilizers.

loans.name: Rayen Wuapi Group

texts.es: Luzmira, quien en la fotografía aparece hacia el costado derecho, riendo y viste de negro con un cinturón, vive en Castro, ella pertenece al Banco Comunal Rayen Wuapi, en donde sus socios tienen paqueterías, venden lencería, chacarería, algunos son modistas, tiene verdulerías y peluquerías. Luzmira tiene una peluquería, y ella comenzó con su negocio hace aproximadamente 20 años, ya que ella estudió para eso., aunque dejo de trabajar algún tiempo cuando tuvo a su hijo, pero ya lo retomo, agradece no haber tenido problemas en su negocio. Nos cuenta además que le dinero que esta solicitando lo ocupara para comprara y renovar algunos insumos que necesita en su peluquería. Ella está muy entusiasmada porque sabe que le irá muy bien en este ciclo. Además nos comenta que está muy contenta y agradecida de poder trabajar junto a Fondo Esperanza ya que no había encontrado otro lugar en donde la apoyaran y la ayudarán tanto, en donde se preocupen de enseñarles y capacitarlas para mejorar cada día mas su negocio.
texts.en: Luzmira, who appears in the photo on the right-hand side, smiling and wearing black with a belt, lives in Castro. She belongs to the communal bank Rayen Wuapi, where the members have parcel services, sell lingerie, run truck farms; some have dressmaker shops, produce shops, and beauty salons. Luzmira has a beauty shop. She began her business about 20 years ago, because she studied for this. Although she stopped working for a while when she had her son, now she has gone back to work. She expresses thanks that she hasn’t had problems with her business. She says that the money she is asking for will be used to buy and restock some supplies that she needs in her salon. She is very excited because she knows that things will go well for her this cycle. Additionally, she says that she is very happy and thankful to be able to work with Fondo Esperanza because she hadn’t found another place where they support her and help her so much, where they are concerned with teaching and training women to improve their businesses day by day.

loans.use: to buy supplies for a beauty salon.

loans.name: Nancy Esther

texts.es: Nancy de 50 años de edad tiene un pequeño salón de belleza, donde ofrece cortes de cabello, peinados, tintes, cremas alisadoras, manicure, pedicure etc.  Ella en su condición de separada es madre de 3 hijos en edades adultas y con su actividad  en la que tiene 36 años de antigüedad, cuando su amiga le enseñó el oficio, ha logrado sostener su familia. Hace 1 año inició su propia aventura independiente de negocio, con el sueño de incrementar sus ingresos familiares , por eso su meta actual es desarrollar al máximo potencial de su salón de belleza, tener todos los equipos de trabajo modernos , para convertirlo en una gran empresa. En la actualidad trabaja desde las 9 de la mañana hasta la 9 de la noche y ofrece sus servicios de contado  diariamente a clientes fijos y ocasionales, referidos por sus compradores actuales. La compra de sus insumos las hace en almacenes mayoristas, que le ofrecen buenos precios,  convenientes para que su oferta de servicios le ofrezca la oportunidad de ser competitiva en los precios. Nancy está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará  materias primas e insumos como champo, cremas capilares, equipos de trabajo como aire acondicionado, vitrinas, puerta de servicios. Con su inversión espera una mejora sustancial en la atención de su clientela comodidad y confort para ellos etc.
texts.en: Nancy, who is 50-years old, has a small beauty salon where she offers haircuts, hair styling, hair coloring, straightening creams, manicures, pedicures etc.  She is separated and the mother of three adult children.  She has been in this career for 36 years.  When a friend taught her the trade, she was able to support her family.  One year ago, Nancy started her own, independent business venture with the hope of increasing her family's income.  That is why her current goal is to completely develop her beauty salon's potential, to have modern equipment and convert her salon into a sizable business.  Nancy currently works from 9 o'clock in the morning until 9 o'clock at night.  She runs a cash business and offers her services every day to both regular customers and walk-in customers who are referred by her current clients. Nancy purchases her supplies in wholesale warehouses, which offer better prices.  It works out well for her, as she can then offer her services at competitive prices.  Nancy is requesting a credikiva, her first loan with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, through which she will purchase raw materials and supplies like shampoo and conditioner and workplace equipment like an air conditioner, a display case and a service door.  With the investment, Nancy hopes for a substantial improvement in the service she can offer her customers by increasing both their comfort and their well-being.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials and supplies like shampoo and conditioner and workplace equipment like an air conditioner, a display cabinet and a service door.

loans.name: Irma

texts.es: Irma de 50 años de edad habita en el sur de la ciudad con su cónyuge y su hijo de 19 años de edad. Ella tiene 13 años de experiencia en su negocio donde ofrece servicios de peluquería de manera independiente desde el año 200. Irma terminó sus estudios de licenciatura en educación física y trabajó varios años en esta profesión, pero siguió su aptitud frente a la estética e inició estudios de belleza y se dedicó a ofrecer los servicios de corte de cabello y tratamientos capilares, tiene su propio local y una vitrina que siempre debe tener surtida, y con ella responde parcialmente a las solicitudes de su clientela. En la actualidad trabaja de lunes a domingo desde las 9 de la mañana hasta las 8 de la noche y sus principales clientes habitan en el sector donde está ubicada la peluquería; sus compras las realiza de contado a un distribuidor especializado en productos de estética y belleza.   Su meta mas adelante es tener una sucursal de peluquería y que su hijo termine la universidad, por eso se esmera día a día con el fin de logarlo. Irma ha acudido a la aplicación de un credikiva en la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, primer financiamiento que hace a esta organización, con el fin de invertirlo en la compra de una vitrina mostradora y materiales como cremas, champo, pinta uñas etc.
texts.en:
Irma, 50, lives with her spouse and 19-year-old son in the south of the city.  She has 13 years’ experience, since the year 2000, working independently in a beauty salon.  

She completed her Bachelor’s in Physical Education and worked in this profession for several years but following her aptitude for beauty she started taking beauty courses and went into providing haircuts and scalp treatments.  She has a locale of her own and a display case that must always be well-stocked to partially meet customer demand.

She currently works Monday to Sunday from 9 in the morning until 8 at night and her main customers live in the area where her beauty salon is located.  She buys her supplies from suppliers that specialize in beauty products and pays cash.

Her goal for later on is to open a branch beauty salon and that her son completes university which is why she strives day to day in order to accomplish it.

Irma has applied for a Fundación Mario Santo Domingo Kiva loan, her first financing from this organization, in order to buy a display case and materials like cream, shampoo, nail polish, etc.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics and a display case.

loans.name: Maira Alejandra

texts.es: Maira de 25 años de edad se dedica  la confección, esta actividad siempre le llamó su atención y por eso desde hace 2 años, inició su experiencia emprendedora con su propio negocio, una vez terminó sus estudios de patronaje y escalado, enfocándose preferencialmente en la elaboración de bermudas, pantalonetas y multiusos . Con su negocio y con los recursos que aporta su cónyuge quien trabaja como operario de una empresa, generan ingresos suficientes para atender los gastos de su hogar en el que tienen 2 hijos en las edades de 4 y 6 años. En la actualidad Maira está aplicando aun credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará una máquina plana y una fileteadora, pues su meta es ampliar  su taller, para mas adelante tener su propia casa . Maira trabaja con mucho esmero diariamente,  desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 7 de la noche, incluyendo  2 horas de descanso, y  desde los lunes hasta los sábados. Sus clientes principales son las misceláneas del sector, quienes le hacen pedidos y ella gustosamente las atiende con gran prontitud.
texts.en: Maira, age 25, works as a seamstress. This work has always appealed to her, and so two years ago she began her entrepreneur experience with her own business, after she finished her pattern-making and fitting studies, focusing especially on making bermudas, shorts, and multiuse outfits. With her business and with the money that her husband, who works as a worker in a business, contributes, they generate sufficient income to take care of the household expenses. Their household includes two children, ages 4 and 6. Currently, Maira is applying for a Kiva loan, the first financing that Fundación Mario Santo Domingo is giving. With this she will buy a tabletop sewing machine and an overlock sewing machine, because her goal is to expand her workshop, and eventually to have her own home. Maira works painstakingly everyday, from 8 in the morning to 7 at night (including two hours of rest), from Monday to Saturday. Her primary customers are the shops in the area, who have placed orders with her and whom she gladly takes care of promptly.

loans.use: to buy a table-top sewing machine and an overlock sewing machine.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase blocks, gravel, cement, iron and quarry rock.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy clothing, food products, and other items to sell.

loans.name: Maribel

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal SOLIDARIDAD - CCACHIMAYO, la socia continua dedicándose a su negocio de venta de ropa interior y venta de zapatos, la socia llevan buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia vende su mercadería a pedido a sus amistades, familiares y otros, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa siendo de esta forma que la socia saca adelante a su familia.

La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de zapatos para damas.

La socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
This borrower is a member of the Communal Bank “Solidaridad – Ccachimayo”.  She has a business of selling undergarments and shoes.  The borrower has been in business for some time and is doing well thanks to the effort she puts forth each day into her work.  She sells merchandise upon request to her friends, relatives, and other people.  She is a responsible and diligent individual who is helping her family move forward in this manner.  

The borrower is requesting a loan in order to buy women’s shoes.  She is grateful for the loan that has been provided and promises to complete her payments according to the established terms.

loans.use: to buy women's shoes to sell.

loans.name: Julius

texts.en:
Julius is 45 and is married to Ruth; they are blessed with two children, ages 10 and 2.  His main source of income comes from the farming business he does in the Kabiyet division in Nandi county.  He has been in this business for more than five years; from this business he gets an average monthly profit of Kes. 20,000.

He has borrowed a fifth loan of Kes 100,000 from KADET LTD, and intends to use this to purchase farm inputs (i.e. fertilizer, pesticides, and herbicides).  The profits he earns will be used to increase his working capital and expand the current business.

His dream is to be financially stable, give the best education to his children, and expand his business using the current farming technologies.

loans.use: To purchase farm inputs

loans.name: Hafitha

texts.en:
Hafitha is a 34-year-old a single mother of one child. She runs a greengrocer business in Kitengela town and has been in the business for four years. She also sells retail goods such as flour and rice, among other items. She currently gets a monthly income of 8,000 Kenyan shillings (KES).

This is her first loan with KADET LTD and she will use the loan to purchase more vegetables and retail goods such as cooking oil, rice, and flour to sell. She plans to open another greengrocery shop from the profits that she will make. 

Her hope and dream is to give her child a quality education.

loans.use: To buy vegetables for her grocery shop.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: This marks Rose's fourth borrowing from KADET Ltd, after servicing her previous loans successfully. She will use the loan to purchase more fruits and vegetables like spinach, oranges, tomatoes and kale to expand her business. With the anticipated profit, Rose hopes to attract more clients as well as expand her business. She hopes to see her ventures grow to bigger heights in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase more cabbages, spinach, oranges, tomatoes and kale.

loans.name: Magdaline

texts.en:
Magdaline is a married woman. She has six children. She describes herself to be self-driven. 

She operates a grocery store where she sells green maize. She has been involved in this business for two years. Her business is located in a busy area and her primary customers are the general public. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate stock. 

Magdaline will use the KES 20,000 loan to add stocks of green maize and other items. This is her first loan with SMEP Deposit Taking Microfinance (SMEP DTM).

loans.use: to add stocks of green maize and other items.

loans.name: Syprose

texts.en:
Syprose, a 34-year-old married mother of nine children ranging from 1 year to 18 years, describes herself as humble. She has been operating a retail store where she sells cooking oil, bar soap, bread and other household items for eight years. Her business is located in a rural area, and her primary customers are rural residents. 


Syprose will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy stocks of bread, cooking oil, bar soap and other items. Her business goal is to expand within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will be able to better provide for her family. This is her first loan with SMEP DTDM.

loans.use: to buy stocks of bread, cooking oil, bar soap and other items

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
Eunice is a 32-year-old married woman. She has two children, ages 1 year and 8 years. She describes herself to be innovative. 

She operates a retail shop where she sells sugar, cooking oil, wheat flour and other items. She has been involved in this business for five years. Her business is located in a good area, and her primary customers are the general public. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of funds. 

She will use the KES 20,000 loan to add stock of soap, sugar, cooking oil and other items. Her business goal is to be prosperous within five years.

loans.use: to add stock of soap, sugar, cooking oil and other items.

loans.name: Margret

texts.en: Margret is a forty-five-year-old, married woman with five children living in Kasese, Uganda.  She has been selling cassava flour for twenty-six years but also practices agriculture to earn extra income.  Price fluctuation and unpredictable seasonal weather changes affect her business growth.  Her desire is to own a food store that can sustainably supply her customers all year round.  Margret intends to use the loan to buy cassava flour to sell.

loans.use: to buy cassava flour to sell.

loans.name: Birungi

texts.en:
Birungi is a 50-year-old widow with five children, living in Kasese, Uganda.

She has been in poultry business for 13 years.  She also grows crops and rears cows to earn a living.  

The high cost of feeds and inadequate capital pose a challenge to her vision of owning at least 1,000 birds and being able to supply the vast market. Birungi intends to use the loan to buy poultry feed.

A good parent that she is, she desires to educate her children to attain degrees as a minimum qualification.

loans.use: to buy poultry feed

loans.name: Sephrose

texts.en:
Sephrose is a 41-year-old married woman with four children, living in Kasese, Uganda.

She has been a teacher for 20 years.  With her meager salary, she was able to build rental houses that give her extra income.

Sephrose intends to use the loan to pay school fees for her children.  A good mother that she is, she desires to educate her children up to the University, despite inadequate capital.

loans.use: to pay school fees for her children.

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James is 29 years old and has three children.  He lives in Fort Portal, Uganda, where he is involved in the transport business and operates a retail shop in order to earn extra income. Customers failing to pay and the high cost fuel are his major challenges.

James is requesting a loan, which he will use to buy general merchandise such as soap and salt to sell. His dream is to own a wholesale shop.

loans.use: to purchase general merchandise such as soap and salt to sell.

loans.name: Sam

texts.en:
Sam is a 23-year-old hard-working man living in Masindi, Uganda.

Sam sells herbal health products, and he has been in business for five years now.  With the proceeds, he has been able to pay school fees for his siblings.

Sam intends to use the loan to buy more health products to sell.  Stiff competition from other health product providers limits his profits, while his dream is to trade in wholesale and expand into new markets.

loans.use: to buy health products to sell.

loans.name: Blanca Flor

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Chimborazo se reúne cada quince días en la parroquia Picoaza de la ciudad de Portoviejo. Lugar conocido por ser una zona muy comercial, por sus fiestas tradicionales de San Pedro y San Pablo y por la alegría de su gente.

En este lugar vive la señora Blanca, tiene 41 años de edad, está separada y de esa relación tiene un hijo de 21 años el cual aun viven con ella y estudia en la  universidad.

Doña Blanca para salir adelante se dedica al comercio, vende ropa de todo tipo, sobrecamas, zapatillas, edredones, toldos y todo lo que pueda vender,  su forma de  venta es puerta a puerta y también vende en su  casa hasta donde llegan sus clientes si necesitan algún producto. Trabaja tres  días a la semana de preferencia en las mañanas,  deja sus productos a crédito y cobra cada domingo. Lleva más de 10 años que se dedica a esta actividad con la cual sale adelante ella sola.

Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar más mercadería como ropa, sabanas, toldos y todo de lo que vende. Lleva 3 ciclos en el banco comunal y le gusta porque los  créditos le permiten financiar en parte su negocio y mejorarlo día a día. 

Su sueño es seguir adelante en su negocio.
texts.en:
The "Chimborazo" communal bank meets every fortnight in the Picoaza parish of the city of Portoviejo.  This is an area well-known for it businesses, its traditional San Pedro and San Pablo parties, and because its people are so happy.

Blanca lives here in Picoaza.  She is 41 years old and is separated.  She has a 21-year-old son from her marriage, and he continues to live with her.  He is studying at university.

In order to get ahead in business, Blanca sells clothing of all types: she sells bedspreads, trainers, quilts, awning and anything else that she can sell.  Blanca sells door-to-door and also out of her home, where her customers come when they need something.  She works three days a week, and prefers to work in the morning.  She sells on credit, collecting payments every Sunday.  Blanca has been doing this work for over ten years and it is helping her to prosper.

Blanca will use this loan to buy more merchandise such as clothes, bed-sheets, awnings and other items to sell.  She has been with the communal bank for three loan cycles and likes it as the loans help her to finance her business and improve it every day.

Blanca's dream is to continue to move ahead. with her business.

loans.use: to buy clothes, bed-sheets, awnings, and more.

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy is the mother of one child who goes to school. She lives in a rental house that has no electricity but has piped water.

She has operated a retail shop business for the past two years, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. She faces a major challenge of late payment from her customers. 

With the loan she is requesting she wants to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour, soap, tea leaves, and wheat flour to sell. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business

loans.use: to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour, soap, tea leaves, and wheat flour for resale

loans.name: Jemce

texts.en:
Jemce is 31 years old, married and lives in Montserrado County, which is the number one commercial city in Liberia since it has the capital city of Liberia. She is a high school dropout. 

For six years she has been involved in the sales of tea and bread at her booth. She makes lots of profit every time when she sells, and she has more customers. She started this business with money from her grandmother, and learned this way of selling from her friends. She spends eight hours a day, six days a week on her business.  

Jemce is requesting a loan to buy more boxes of tea, milk, sugar, butter, mayonnaise, bread, etc. to increase her sales. She plans to establish another booth and educate her children.

loans.use: to buy more boxes of tea, milk, sugar, butter, mayonnaise, bread, etc. to increase her sales.

loans.name: Anjela

texts.en:
Angela lives in Meghri, Syuniq Region, with her husband and daughter. She is a very hard-working woman and is currently self-employed, taking care of her family by cattle breeding and gardening. She owns a plot of land and cultivates apricots, peaches, cherries, figs and blood oranges. 

To meet her family's basic needs Angela now wants to expand her livestock of cows. For this reason she asks for the lenders support in collecting a loan of USD 3,000 to buy three more cows. As this is Angela's first loan, it has been approved within the framework of the new joint initiative of Kiva and SEF. The first-chance loan program provides loans to people who haven't had access to credit products before, because they have no credit history. Angela will purchase new cows with the loan and it will help her to take care of her family.

loans.use: to pay for three cows.

loans.name: Josephine's Group

texts.en:
Lydia is 29 years old, married, and has one child. She sells creams and wigs, which she has been doing for four years.  She works from 7:00 AM to 9:00 PM daily and is able to earn a very good return each month. 

Lydia is requesting her fifth loan request from ID-Ghana for 500 GHS, which she will use to buy more cosmetics and wigs to sell to customers. She used the previous loans to restock her store and they were repaid successfully. Her profits will be used to cover household expenses and school fees for her child. She dreams of building a house.

Lydia is requesting this loan with five other group members, who hold each other accountable for repaying the loan. Lydia is standing second from the right in the photograph.

loans.use: to purchase cosmetics and wigs

loans.name: Venansio

texts.en:
Venansio is a 34-year-old, married man, with two children, living in Kamwenge, Uganda. 

He is a teacher and he was inspired into service by his desire to nurture young people. Low salary and poor working conditions are his major challenges, while his dream is to buy land for farming.

Venansio intends to use the loan to buy land for farming.

loans.use: to buy land for farming.

loans.name: Oumar

texts.fr:
Monsieur  OUMAR est âgé de 36 ans et vit avec son épouse et ses trois enfants dans la sous préfecture de KANGARE, Région de SIKASSO.
OUMAR n’a pas eu la chance  d’aller à l’école. Très tôt  il s’intéressa à la soudure. Il a appris cette activité auprès de son oncle maternel, qui  fut jadis un grand soudeur à OUELESSEBOUGOU. 
Dans le souci de satisfaire sa clientèle en nette croissance, il décida de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso. Il est à son deuxième prêt individuel  qui servira à acheter de la matière première pour la soudure (tôles, baguettes, barres de fer) auprès des grossistes de BAMAKO qu’il transforme en porte et fenêtre et revend aux clients de OUELESSEBOUGOU à crédit et au comptant à une clientèle mixte.
OUMAR espère réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 125.000. FCFA qui sera utilisé pour rembourser le prêt et  être réinvestir le reste dans les activités.
texts.en:
OUMAR, age 36, lives with his wife and their three children in the sub-prefecture of KANGARE, region of SIKASSO.

OUMAR did not get to go to school. He became interested in welding at an early age, and learned this trade from his maternal uncle who used to be a renowned welder in OUELESSEBOUGOU.

To meet the needs of a growing customer base, he joined the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso. This is his second loan cycle with the MFI, and he plans to use this credit to buy the raw materials needed for welding (sheet metal, rods, iron bars) from wholesalers in BAMAKO. He transforms this material into doors and windows, which he sells to a mixed clientele in OUELESSEBOUGOU, cash or credit.

OUMAR expects to earn an average monthly profit of 125,000 FCFA, which he will use to repay his loan and to invest in is activity.

loans.use: to buy welding materials.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase input items to open a fast food business.

loans.name: Jose Daniel

texts.es: José Daniel, mayor de edad, casado con un hijo menor de edad, originario del municipio de Chinandega zona donde predomina el comercio y el turismo, José tiene una relojería ubicada en uno de los mercados de este municipio donde ofrece el servicio de repuestos varios, fajas, controles, relojes entre otros al igual que tiene una pulpería en su casa de habitación donde ofrece productos de consumo del hogar como: granos básicos, golosinas, detergentes, cosméticos entre otros, el tiene clientes fijos y eventuales en los cuales da al crédito y al contado recuperando semanal y quincenal, el objetivo de de este crédito es para invertir en capital de trabajo en la compra de productos de consumo: arroz, azúcar, golosinas, detergentes al igual que materia prima para su relojería. José Daniel agradece mucho el apoyo que los inversionistas kivas les ofrece a personas de bajos recursos económicos
texts.en:
José Daniel is married and has a young son. He is from the region of Chinandega, a zone with a strong tourism industry and business sector. José operates a clock and watch shop in one of the local markets where he repairs and sells clocks and watches. When he is not working at his clock and watch shop, José runs a small convenience store out of his home and sells a wide variety of products, including: staple grains, candy, detergents, cosmetics, etc. He has worked hard to grow his customer base, and he now has many faithful clients. José, offers payments plants to his clients and works with them to collect payments every 1-2 weeks.

With the support from this loan, José plans to purchase merchandise to stock his convenience store (rice, sugar, candy, detergents, etc.), as well as order replacement parts for clocks and watches for use in repair projects at his shop. José is very grateful for this opportunity and to Kiva lenders for their support.

loans.use: to purchase replacement clock and watch parts for repair projects at his business and merchandise to stock his convenience store.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn, a 35-year-old married mother of four, lives in Tuburan, Pagadian  City Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines where she conducts a direct-sales business, earning PHP 10,000 each month. 
 

Jocelyn, a member of PMPC for six years, has requested a loan to restock her inventories. In the future she wants to build her own establishment from which to sell her products.

loans.use: to restock inventories for her direct-selling business

location.town: Pagadian-Tuburan, Pagadian City Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Luciana

texts.en:
Luciana is 45 years old and lives in Tuburan, Pagadian City Zamboanga del Sur, in the Philippines. She is married, with two children.

Luciana has a small store that sells goods and dry goods. She has had this business for 10 years. She has requested a loan for additional capital and to buy more products to sell.

Luciana has been a member of PMPC for six years.  In the future, she hopes to build a bigger store for her products.

loans.use: to add capital and buy more products for her store

location.town: Pagadian - Tuburan, Pagadian City Zamboanga Del Su

loans.name: Francisca

texts.en: Francisca is 38 years old and lives in Patawag, Labason, Zamboanga del Norte. She is married with 3 children. She raises pigs and sells them to make a living. She has been doing this for 5 years. She has requested a loan to buy more pigs to sell. She is a new member of PMPC. In the future, Francisca hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: buy more pigs to sell

loans.name: Mary Grace

texts.en: Mary Grace runs a general store in Maningcol, Ozamiz City. She is 37 years old, married, and blessed with 5 children. She has previously gotten a loan and has successfully repaid it in a timely manner. Now, she is asking for a loan to purchase more stock to sell, like canned goods, soft drinks, detergents and others. Mary Grace wishes to maintain a good membership with PMPC.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell, like canned goods, soft drinks, detergents and others.

loans.name: Nurapa

texts.ru: Нурапа 56 лет, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 4 детей. У Нурапы - среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи, Нурапа занимается животноводством и полеводством, стартовав 19 лет назад, с покупки скота на 10,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Нурапы, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 1 дойная корова, 1 бычок, 20 овец, а также имеет земельный надел размером 2,09 ГА, на которой она ежегодно выращивает: фасоль. Ежемесячный доход Нурапы составляет 10,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Нурапа обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) с целью использовать кредит на сбор урожая. Доходы от кредита Нурапа планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на строительство нового дома.
texts.en: Nurapa is 56 years old and married. She and her husband have four children. Nurapa has received secondary education. As a main source of income for her family, Nurapa is raising livestock and growing farm produce, having launched 19 years ago by buying cattle for 10,000 KGS. Thanks to Nurapa’s hard work, her farm now includes one dairy cow, one , and 20 sheep. She also has a land plot of 2.09 ha [about 5.2 acres], where she grows beans every year. Nurapa’s monthly income is 10,000 KGS. With the goal of developing her business further, Nurapa has turned to the “Bai Tushum & Partners” microfinance institution for a loan in the amount of 100,000 KGS in order to use this loan for harvesting. Nurapa plans to use her resulting revenue in a further increase of cattle headcount. She plans to save up money to buy a new house.

loans.use: to pay for harvest help.

loans.name: Tamara

texts.en:
Tamara is from Stepanavan city of the Lori region. Her family consists of her husband and son. Tamara is a private entrepreneur and currently runs a grocery store in the city. The income from the store helps the family to cover their basic costs. The small grocery store that Tamara runs can hardly meet the needs of the family. This is the reason why she wants to expand the store a little bit and to sell a bigger quantity of products. 

Tamara took a loan from a local financial institution before and unfortunately wasn't able to pay it back because the family had hard times. However, thanks to Tamara's hard work recently, she has been able to run her business in a sustainable way, ensuring that she can cover the monthly payments. So, Tamara has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The second-chance loan program provides loans to people who have a bad credit history and have no access to credit products. The lenders will greatly support Tamara and her family by giving her an opportunity to collect the loan and to expand the business so that they can meet their daily costs.

loans.use: to pay for supplies for her grocery store.

loans.name: Fobis

texts.en:
Fobis is a thirty-seven-year-old married woman with eleven children living in Kasese,Uganda. 

For twenty-six years, she has been operating a retail shop, and with the proceeds she has been able to build a rental house and buy land for farming. Price fluctuation and the high cost of rent are her major challenges. Her dream is to own a wholesale shop.

Fobis intends to use the loan to buy soap and sugar to sell.

loans.use: to buy soap and sugar to sell.

loans.name: Patricia

texts.en:
Patricia has more than 30 years of experience decorating cakes and more than five years owning her business, Angeli Cakes in El Paso, Texas.  She gained her experience by completing a mail order cake class in her earlier years and started her business with savings from her past and by working.  As a child, Patricia’s passion was always in the cake decorating business.

Now, a successful 53-year-old, Patricia offers a variety of custom baked-to-order cakes for the El Paso community.  Customers are able to pick and choose what kind of cake and frosting they want, design and color, and anything else a person can dream up.  Patricia also caters to her customers who are conscientious about their health.  Many of her cakes are gluten and sugar-free and sold to physical trainers, diabetics, and health gurus.

Accion Texas Inc., a nonprofit micro and small business lender, helped Patricia’s business, Angeli Cakes. After Patricia was referred to the microlender when visiting True Credit, a business specializing in credit restoration, she received a loan to purchase additional baking equipment, supplies, cake mix and decorations to meet the increased demand of orders while keeping her employee on payroll.

loans.use: to purchase additional baking equipment, supplies, cake mix and decorations

loans.name: Nerlita

texts.en:
As a married mother of one kid, Nerlita works hard to support her family.

She operates a used clothing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from raising pigs and selling home products. Nerlita is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF in order to purchase additional used clothing to sell to customers.

Nerlita has been sustaining her business activities through her past two loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to expand her business and continue to send her child to school.

loans.use: to purchase additional used clothing to sell.

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.en:
Yolanda is a hardworking entrepreneur in the Philippines who has a business of making hollow blocks (cement blocks). She has been in this business for 3 years and earns more income from a general store.
