Krin looks old, but she is still strong enough to work. She asks for a loan to buy seed, fertilizer and pesticide to maintain her rice farm.

loans.use: To buy seed, fertilizer and pesticide to maintain her rice farm.

loans.name: Sereeter

texts.en:
Mr. Sereeter, 49 years old, lives with his wife and son in an old house on a plot of land in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He has been rendering taxi service to local people using his automobile for seven years. Prior to this he worked as a driver for a private company for 5 years. His wife is a cook and works in a restaurant. Their son studies at a university. 

Mr. Sereeter is requesting a loan of 2,000,000 MNT to purchase building and insulation materials such as bricks, cement, fiberglass and foam. Using those materials, he will repair and insulate his house. After renovation, his family will reduce the amount of coal they burn for heating and release fewer pollutants into air. The borrower is a very hardworking individual who strives for a better future.

loans.use: to buy building and insulation materials

loans.name: Kosñipata Group

texts.es:
Un grupo de pobladores en la ciudad de Pilcopata formaron el banco comunal “Kosñipata” en la provincia de Paucartambo hace varios años atrás. En la ciudad de Pilcopata no existen muchas industrias, empresas, bancos pero existen grandes terrenos de cultivos por lo tanto la mayoría de los pobladores se dedican a la agricultura, a la ganadería, a la venta de madera y frutas.   

 Lucia tiene 50 años de edad y nació en la ciudad de Puno pero vive en la ciudad de Pilcopata desde hace 6 años, ella tiene una relación de unión libre de la cual cinco hijos de las cuales tres son independientes y dos todavía están a su lado, ella es una mujer responsable y amable que sale adelante pues su actividad económica principal es la cosecha de coca y piña, ella en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar más fertilizantes. (Lucia en la fotografía está levantando la mano). (Las personas que aparecen en la parte inferior de la fotografía pidieron permiso para no estar presentes en la reunión). 

Los socios en general agradecen la oportunidad brindada y se comprometen a cumplir con el pago de sus diferentes cuotas en los plazos establecidos.
texts.en:
This group of inhabitants from the city of Pilcopata gathered to create the "Kosñipata" communal bank in the Paucartamba province some years ago.  There are not many industries, business or banks in Pilcopata but there are large plots of land for cultivating and so the majority of inhabitants work in farming, cattle-raising, and selling wood and fruits.

Lucia is 50 years old. She was born in the city of Puno but has lived in the city of Pilcopata for six years.  She has a partner, with whom she has five children.  Three of the children are now independent while two continue to live by her side. Lucia is responsible and friendly. She is moving ahead as her main work is growing coca plants and pineapples.  On this occasion she needs a  loan to buy more fertiliser.  (In the photo Lucia is the one with her hand raised).  (The two people in the separate photos sent their apologies as they were unable to be present at the meeting).

All of the members are grateful for the opportunity being provided and promise to make their respective repayments on time.

loans.use: to buy more fertiliser.

loans.name: Veronica Vanessa

texts.es: Verónica Vanesa mayor de edad casada con 2 hijos menores de edad del domicilio de Chinandega zona ubicada en el occidente del país, ella inicia su negocio desde muy joven buscando un medio digno de vivir y a la misma vez criar a sus hijos sin descuidarlos, Verónica es propietaria de una pequeña pulpería donde ofrece productos de consumo como: arroz, azúcar, frijoles, aceite, shampoo, café, salsas de tomates, sal, pan, huevos, golosinas, productos congelados, leña, entre otros, negocio ubicado en su casa de habitación el cual atiende desde muy temprano y cerrando hasta tarde dando excelentes servicios a sus clientelas el cual desempeña con mucho gusto debido a que ha sido su forma de vida y la de su familia. El objetivo de este crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su pulpería para así brindarles un mejor servicio a sus clientes y en un futuro aumentar sus ingresos. Uno de sus sueños es de mejorar su vivienda para darle un techo digno donde vivir a sus hijos y verlos en futuro no muy lejanos profesionales cada uno de ellos, Verónica agradece mucho el apoyo que los inversionistas kivas les ofrece a personas de bajos recursos económicos para a si tener medio digno de trabajo.-
texts.en: Verónica is married and has two children, both under 18 years old.  She is from the Chinandega area in the west of Nicaragua.  She started her business from a very young age as she was looking to make a decent living and to raise her children without neglecting them.  Verónica owns a small grocery store where she offers consumer products such as rice, sugar, beans, oil, shampoo, coffee, tomato sauces, salt, bread, eggs, sweets, frozen products, firewood, and more.  She runs the business out of her home, opening very early in the morning and closing very late at night.  Throughout the day Verónica happily provides her customers with excellent service.  This has been Verónica and her family's way to make a living.  Verónica will invest this loan in working capital and stock up her grocery store so as to offer better service to her customers and, in the future, increase her income.  One of Verónica's dreams is to improve her home so as to give her children a decent place to live.  She soon wants to see her children grow up to have a career. Verónica is very grateful to Kiva lenders who are offering people with little financial resources the opportunity to have a decent job.

loans.use: to buy products for the home such as rice, beans, sugar, oil, soap, detergents, shampoo, coffee, frozen products, and more.

loans.name: Nelsie

texts.en:
Nelsie is 34 years old and married with one child who is in school.

Nelsie works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 19,500 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock items like soy sauce, vinegar, soft drinks and other products to sell.

Nelsie has borrowed and repaid 10 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for six years and also earns an income from pig fattening.

Nelsie aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock products like soy sauce, vinegar, soft drinks and others to sell

loans.name: Chanthol

texts.en:
Chanthol (in the photo) is 53 years old. She lives in a suburb of Phnom Penh. Chanthol has three children. One is married, one is a garment worker and another one assists his parents in the business. 

Chanthol and her husband buy and sell recycling materials. She is applying for a loan to paint the house where she lives.

loans.use: To paint the house where she lives.

loans.name: Pheap

texts.en:
Pheap (in the photo), age 30, is a garment worker. She lives in a village about 35 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. She has been married since 2005 and has two young sons. Her husband is a construction worker.

Pheap is applying for a loan in order to buy a cow to raise. She will be able to earn more income by selling the calves when the cow gives birth or by selling the cow for beef.

loans.use: To buy a cow to raise.

loans.name: Princess Joy

texts.en:
Princess Joy is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF to purchase additional spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle for her motorcycle transport business.

Princess Joy has been in this business for one year. Princess Joy earns additional income from farming and selling peanuts.

Princess Joy has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle

loans.name: Girlie

texts.en:
Girlie is 38 years old and married with 3 children. Her children are all in school. Girlie works very hard to provide for them.

Girlie runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell.

Girlie has been in this business for ten years and sells a variety of items such as snack foods, canned goods and other groceries. 

In the future, Girlie would like to save money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Rema

texts.en:
Rema is 37 years old and married with four children.

Rema earns a living by farming sugarcane in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 19,500 through NWTF to pay for laborers' salaries for the clean up of her sugarcane plantation.

Rema has been farming sugarcane for 13 years. She earns additional income from a general store.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and has requested this new loan to further build her business.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to pay laborers' salaries for the clean up of her sugarcane plantation

loans.name: Maria Luisa

texts.es:
María ha crecido con su negocio gracias a los 4 años que ha trabajado con Fundación Alternativa en donde además del financiamiento ha obtenido capacitación personalizada lo cual le ha servido de mucho para administrar mejor los recursos de su microempresa. 
Sus hijos han continuado sus estudios sin que les falte nada y además siempre le están ayudando en el restaurante que atiende en horas de la tarde y noche, trabajo que disfruta mucho pues lo aprendió desde muy joven con su tía que también tiene un restaurante. 
María sueña con que sus hijos alcancen una profesión y tengan éxito, por lo cual no dejará de luchar y esforzarse para que a ellos nunca les falte nada, pues ésa es su mayor motivación para el crecimiento. Por esta razón ahora solicita un nuevo crédito que lo utilizará en hacer arreglos a la infraestructura de su local, principalmente la parte de afuera en donde elabora comida rápida, pues es importante que el lugar llame la atención para que sus clientes aumenten y así mejoren sus ingresos y ella pueda ganar recomendaciones por el deliciosa sazón de su comida y también por un ambiente excelente del lugar.
texts.en:
María has developed her business thanks to the four years that she has been working with Fundación Alternativa. Here, in addition to financing, she has received personalised training that has helped her very much in better administering her small business's resources.

Her children have continued their studies, without lacking for anything. In addition, they are always helping her out in the restaurant in the afternoon and evening. They enjoy this work a lot as they learned it from a very young age from their aunt, who also has a restaurant. 

María dreams that her children will achieve professional careers and be successful, which is why she never stops struggling and striving so that they want for nothing. This is her main motivation for growing the restaurant. For this reason she is now seeking a new loan, which she will use to carry out repairs to the structure of her premises, chiefly the part outside where she prepares fast food. It is very important that it attracts attention so that she receives more customers. This way her income will improve and she will be able to win recommendations for the delicious flavour of her food as well as the restaurant's excellent atmosphere.

loans.use: to carry out repairs to the structure of her premises.

loans.name: And Siggil Hann 12 Group

texts.fr: L’Association And Siggil Hann regroupe plusieurs femmes ressortissant de l’une des banlieues  Dakaroises. Au départ elles se fréquentaient   a travers des  tontines  hebdomadaires  qui leur permettaient de s’autofinancer pour soutenir leurs activités génératrices de revenus .Actuellement l’association vient de signer un partenariat avec l’UIMCEC dans le cadre du renforcement du pouvoir économique des femmes  pour les aider  a mieux gérer leurs activités et lutter contre la pauvreté. De ce fait And Siggil Hann 12  est un groupe de crédit de 10 femmes  qui habitent le même quartier et évoluent  dans le même secteur d’activité. Elles sont représentées par madame Anta, femme mariée qui  évolue dans le secteur du commerce de poissons depuis plus de 20 ans. En même temps elle exerce depuis 3 ans l’aviculture. Elle démarre chaque jour sa journée  de travail a 7  heures du matin pour descendre a  14  heures l’après midi. Les bénéfices que lui procure ses  activités  lui permettent de participer a la dépense quotidienne de son foyer. Elle est membre de l’un des guichets de l’UIMCEC ou elle sollicite un crédit prévu pour l’achat de  poissons frais qu’elle va revendre sur le marché.  Son objectif est d’accroitre  les  bénéfices que lui génère son activité de vente de poissons ce qui lui permettre d’épargner de l’argent et de contribuer a l’amélioration des conditions alimentaires de sa famille.Le projet qu’elle souhaite réaliser dans le futur est d’acquérir son  propre véhicule de livraison de poissons frais.
texts.en:
The "And Siggil Hann" group comprises several women from one of Dakar's suburbs. In the past, these women used to interact with one another through weekly savings groups' meetings which allowed them to self-finance and support their income-generating activities. With the aim of strengthening the economic power of women, the group has recently entered into partnership with the UIMCEC, whose mission is to help them to better manage their professional activities and come out of poverty. "And Siggil Hann 12" is therefore a credit group consisting of ten women who live in the same neighborhood and who are involved in the same type of business.

The group's representative is named Anta. She is a married woman who has been selling fish for more than 20 years.  Additionally she has been involved in poultry farming for the past three years. Anta works from 7 AM until 2 PM every day. With the profits that she makes from her business, she is able to contribute to the daily expenses of the family.

Anta is a member of one of the local branches of the UIMCEC and she is requesting a loan to buy fresh fish for resale at the market.  Her goal is to increase her profits from her fish-selling business, which will in turn help her to save some money and to contribute to the improvement of her family's food conditions.  Her future project is to acquire her own vehicle, which she would use to deliver fresh fish.

loans.use: to buy fresh fish for resale.

loans.name: Toem

texts.en:
Toem is 44 years old and a father of four children, living in his own home in Pursat province. There he grows rice on about one and a half hectares of farmland, earning a profit of approximately $7.00 per day from his hardships. He is a hardworking and honest man who aims to improve his standard of living. Thanks to the work he does, he is able to pay for some of his expenses and educate his children in school.

Toem is requesting a loan of 1,500 USD in order to build a latrine and water storage. Having a latrine and water storage in the household will increase the value of his home, protect the family from spreading diseases, reduce the time and energy burden of water collection from day to day, and enable household members to engage in other activities, among them productive and income-generating activities. He hopes to have a fruitful harvest to meet the basic needs of his family.

loans.use: to build a latrine and water storage.

loans.name: Salvacion

texts.en:
Salvacion is 61 years old and married with four children. She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. 

Salvacion is borrowing PHP 19,000 through NWTF to buy fertilzers and other farm supplies.

Salvacion has been farming rice for 10 years and also earns income from buying and selling rice.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilzers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Hoseah

texts.en: Hoseah is a married man. He has one child. He describes himself as honest. He operates a store selling curtains and basins. He has been involved in this business for 10 years. His business is located in a market area, and his primary customers are retailers. He describes his biggest business challenge as lack of enough funds to boost his business. He will use this 60,000 Kenyan shilling (KES) loan to buy bed sheets to sell. His business goal is to open another shop within five years. This is his third loan with SMEP Deposit Taking Microfinance. His previous loan of 60,000 KES was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy bed sheets to sell

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita is a hardworking entrepreneur. She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines.

Lolita is borrowing PHP 19,000 through NWTF in order to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Lolita successfully paid back her previous loan and is requesting a new loan to further build her business.

NWTF is listing Lolita's business profile again in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Rachidatou

texts.fr: Rachidatou  est mariée et mère de 02 enfants, (05 et 1an 05mois), elle vit avec sa famille dans le quartier de Totsi qui est un quartier périphérique de la ville de Lomé. Elle exerce comme activité génératrice de revenu le commerce de produits d'alimentation générale. En ce moment elle fait face à une baisse de son stock de produits d'alimentation générale. Voulant se réapprovisionner, elle sollicite de WAGES un second crédit pour l'achat des sacs de riz, des bidons d'huile, des cartons de spaghetti et divers produits. Elle a 32ans, a démarré en 2009.
texts.en: Rachidatou is married and the mother of two children (a 5-year-old and a 17-month-old).  She lives with her family in Totsi, a suburb of Lomé.  She makes a living selling general food products.  Her inventory is currently quite low and she would like to rebuild it.  To this end,  she is requesting a second loan from WAGES to buy some bags of rice, cans of oil, boxes of spaghetti and various other products.  Rachidatou is 32.  She started in this business in 2009.

loans.use: to buy grocery products.
